'''Kylian Mbappé Lottin''' (born 20 December 1998) is a French professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]] for {{French football updater|PSG}} club [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] and [[Captain (association football)|captains]] the [[France national football team|France national team]]. Regarded as one of the best players in the world, he is known for his [[Dribbling (association football)|dribbling]], speed, and finishing.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Kylian Mbappe Bio Information – SOCCER |url=https://www.foxsports.com/soccer/kylian-mbappe-2-player-bio |access-date=20 December 2022 |website=FOX Sports |language=en-US |archive-date=20 December 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221220200618/https://www.foxsports.com/soccer/kylian-mbappe-2-player-bio |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=16 November 2022 |title=World Cup Rank: The 50 best footballers of Qatar 2022 |url=https://www.espn.in/football/fifa-world-cup/story/4787456/world-cup-rank-the-50-best-footballers-of-qatar-2022 |access-date=26 November 2022 |publisher=ESPN |archive-date=26 November 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221126182412/https://www.espn.in/football/fifa-world-cup/story/4787456/world-cup-rank-the-50-best-footballers-of-qatar-2022 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Best football players in the world ranked 2024 |url=https://www.radiotimes.com/tv/sport/football/best-football-players-world/ |access-date=2024-03-11 |website=Radio Times |language=en-GB |archive-date=11 March 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240311145315/https://www.radiotimes.com/tv/sport/football/best-football-players-world/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

Born in [[Paris]] and raised in nearby [[Bondy]], Mbappé began his senior club career in 2015 with [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]], where he won the Ligue 1 title in the [[2016–17 AS Monaco FC season|2016–17 season]]. In 2017, aged 18, Mbappé signed for Paris Saint-Germain on an eventual permanent [[Transfer (association football)|transfer]] worth €180 million, making him the second-[[List of most expensive association football transfers|most-expensive player]] and most expensive teenage player of all time.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/soccer-transfers/story/3388743/psg-trigger-kylian-mbappes-permanent-transfer-from-monaco |title=PSG trigger Kylian Mbappe's permanent transfer from Monaco |publisher=ESPN |date=19 February 2018 |access-date=19 February 2018 |archive-date=1 April 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190401165055/http://www.espn.com/soccer/soccer-transfers/story/3388743/psg-trigger-kylian-mbappes-permanent-transfer-from-monaco |url-status=live}}</ref> With PSG, he won six Ligue 1 titles and four [[Coupes de France]], including a domestic [[List of association football teams to have won four or more trophies in one season|quadruple]] in the [[2019–20 Paris Saint-Germain F.C. season|2019–20 season]], while also leading the club to its first ever [[2020 UEFA Champions League final|UEFA Champions League final]] in 2020. He is the club's [[List of Paris Saint-Germain F.C. records and statistics#All-time top scorers|all-time top goalscorer]] and [[List of Paris Saint-Germain F.C. records and statistics#Assists|ranks third]] in [[assist (association football)|assists]], as well as the [[List of Ligue 1 top scorers|seventh-highest goalscorer in Ligue 1 history]].

At international level, Mbappé made his senior debut for France in 2017, at age of 18. At the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]], Mbappé became the youngest French player to score at a World Cup, as well as the second teenager, after [[Pelé]], to score in a [[List of FIFA World Cup finals|World Cup final]]. He finished as the joint second-highest goalscorer as France won the tournament; he went on to win the [[FIFA World Cup Best Young Player Award|FIFA World Cup Best Young Player]] and [[French Player of the Year]] awards for his performances. He also helped France to victory in the [[2020–21 UEFA Nations League|UEFA Nations League]] in 2021, receiving the [[2021 UEFA Nations League Finals#Awards|top scorer award]] in [[2021 UEFA Nations League Finals|the finals]]. At the [[2022 FIFA World Cup]], France reached the [[2022 FIFA World Cup final|final]] again; Mbappé won the [[FIFA World Cup awards#Golden Boot|Golden Boot]] and [[FIFA World Cup awards#Golden Ball|Silver Ball]] and set the record for the [[List of FIFA World Cup final goalscorers|most goals scored in World Cup final matches]] by scoring a [[hat-trick]]. Mbappé is one of only two players to have scored in two consecutive World Cup finals (the other being Brazil's [[Vavá]] in [[1958 FIFA World Cup final|1958]] and [[1962 FIFA World Cup final|1962]]).

Mbappé finished in third place for the [[2023 Ballon d'Or]] and was runner-up for the [[The Best FIFA Football Awards 2022|2022]] [[The Best FIFA Men's Player]] award. He was named to the [[FIFA FIFPro World11]] in [[The Best FIFA Football Awards 2018#FIFA FIFPro World11|2018]], [[The Best FIFA Football Awards 2019#FIFA FIFPro Men's World11|2019]], [[The Best FIFA Football Awards 2022|2022]] and [[The Best FIFA Football Awards 2023|2023]], the [[UEFA Team of the Year]] in [[UEFA Team of the Year#Team of the Year 2018|2018]] and the [[UEFA Champions League#Awards|UEFA Champions League Squad of the Season]] in [[2016–17 UEFA Champions League#Squad of the season|2016–17]], [[2019–20 UEFA Champions League#Squad of the season|2019–20]], [[2020–21 UEFA Champions League#Squad of the season|2020–21]] and [[2021–22 UEFA Champions League#Squad of the season|2021–22]]. He was awarded the [[Golden Boy (award)|Golden Boy]] in 2017, the [[Kopa Trophy]] in 2018, and was shortlisted for the [[Laureus World Sports Award for Sportsman of the Year|Laureus World Sportsman of the Year]] in 2019 and 2023. Mbappé has been named [[Ligue 1 Player of the Year]] a record five times, and has finished as the [[List of Ligue 1 top scorers|Ligue 1 top scorer]] for a record six seasons; in the [[2021–22 Ligue 1|2021–22 season]], he became the first player to finish as both Ligue 1 top scorer and top assist provider. In 2023, he was among ''[[Time 100|Time]]''{{'}}s [[Time 100|100 most influential people in the world]], and was ranked third on the [[Forbes list of the world's highest-paid athletes|''Forbes'' list of the world's highest-paid athletes]].

==Early life==

Why Kylian Mbappe could define the next era of football |first=Julien |last=Laurens |website=FourFourTwo |publisher=Future |date=15 April 2020 |access-date=23 August 2020 |archive-date=23 April 2020 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20200423200718/https://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/kylian-mbappe-best-player-world-messi-ronaldo-psg-france-world-cup |url-status=live}}</ref> His father, {{Interlanguage link|Wilfrid Mbappé|lt=Wilfrid|fr|Wilfrid Mbappé}}, is originally from the [[Cameroon]]ian island of {{Interlanguage link|Djébalè|lt=Djébalè|fr|Djébalè}},<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rfi.fr/fr/afrique/20230708-cameroun-le-footballeur-kylian-mbapp%C3%A9-renoue-avec-ses-racines-%C3%A0-dj%C3%A9bal%C3%A8|title=Cameroun: le footballeur Kylian Mbappé renoue avec ses racines à Djébalè|publisher=Radio France Internationale|date=8 July 2023|accessdate=23 January 2024|language=fr|archive-date=23 January 2024|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240123134842/https://www.rfi.fr/fr/afrique/20230708-cameroun-le-footballeur-kylian-mbapp%C3%A9-renoue-avec-ses-racines-%C3%A0-dj%C3%A9bal%C3%A8|url-status=live}}</ref> and, as well as being his [[Sports agent|agent]], is a football coach. He was a great player, he inspired me.' |archive-date=18 June 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230618122703/https://www.beinsports.com/us/fifa-world-cup/news/mbappe-expects-weird-world-cup-reunion-with-2/923668 |url-status=live }}</ref> As a child, Mbappé received [[Robinho]]'s [[AC Milan]] shirt as a gift from his nanny's family, who were supporters of the Italian club.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.marca.com/en/football/psg/2022/05/24/628cc90822601d0d028b45b9.html |title=Mbappe: When I was young I supported AC Milan |newspaper=Marca |location=Madrid |date=24 May 2022 |access-date=7 June 2022 |archive-date=5 June 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220605142102/https://www.marca.com/en/football/psg/2022/05/24/628cc90822601d0d028b45b9.html |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.marca.com/futbol/liga-francesa/2022/05/24/628caddc268e3e5b628b459a.html |title=Ligue 1: Mbappé: 'De pequeño animaba al Milan' |newspaper=Marca |location=Madrid |date=24 May 2022 |access-date=7 June 2022 |archive-date=5 June 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220605140121/https://www.marca.com/futbol/liga-francesa/2022/05/24/628caddc268e3e5b628b459a.html |url-status=live }}</ref> However, Mbappé aspired to play for [[Real Madrid CF|Real Madrid]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.calciomercato.com/news/l-infanzia-rossonera-di-mbappe-gli-regalammo-una-maglia-di-robin-48229 |title=L'infanzia rossonera di Mbappé: 'Gli regalammo una maglia di Robinho, ma diceva che avrebbe giocato nel Real' |language=it |trans-title=Mbappé's Rossoneri childhood: 'We gave him a Robinho shirt, but he said he would play for Real' |date=5 June 2022 |website=calciomercato.com |access-date=5 June 2022 |archive-date=5 June 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220605131203/https://www.calciomercato.com/news/l-infanzia-rossonera-di-mbappe-gli-regalammo-una-maglia-di-robin-48229 |url-status=live }}</ref>

==Club career==
===Early career===
Mbappé was coached by his father, Wilfrid, when he started his career with AS Bondy. Another of his youth coaches at AS Bondy, Antonio Riccardi, stated,

{{blockquote|The first time I coached him was when he was six years old. You could tell he was different. Kylian could do much more than the other children. His dribbling was already fantastic and he was much faster than the others. He was the best player I've ever seen in 15 years coaching here. In Paris, there are many talents but I'd never seen a talent like him. He was what we call a 'crack' (the best).<ref>{{cite news |title=Les Bleus au berceau: "J'étais persuadé que Kylian Mbappé passerait à la télé!" |language=fr |url=http://www.leparisien.fr/sports/football/psg/les-bleus-au-berceau-j-etais-persuade-que-kylian-mbappe-passerait-a-la-tele-03-01-2018-7480863.php |agency=Le Parisien |date=3 January 2018 |access-date=14 September 2018 |archive-date=14 September 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180914203725/http://www.leparisien.fr/sports/football/psg/les-bleus-au-berceau-j-etais-persuade-que-kylian-mbappe-passerait-a-la-tele-03-01-2018-7480863.php |url-status=live}}</ref>}}

Eventually, Mbappé moved to the [[INF Clairefontaine|Clairefontaine]] academy, putting in a host of impressive performances leading to numerous French clubs, and Real Madrid, [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]], attempting to sign him.<ref name="Youth">{{cite news |title=Kylian Mbappe: How France World Cup star rose to prominence |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44669497 |website=BBC Sport |date=1 July 2018 |access-date=1 July 2018 |archive-date=3 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180703152535/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44669497 |url-status=live}}</ref> At the age of 11, Real Madrid invited him to train with their under-12s and visit the club's facilities.<ref>{{cite news |date=1 September 2017 |title=Kylian Mbappe joins Paris St-Germain: Why an 18-year-old is worth £166m |website=BBC Sport |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40904612 |access-date=12 December 2020 |archive-date=14 November 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201114231644/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40904612 |url-status=live }}</ref> Mbappé was tracked by [[Stade Malherbe Caen|Caen]] for three years, but their relegation from [[Ligue 1]] in 2012 and subsequent failure to win promotion meant that they could not afford his signature.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Lainé |first1=Guillaume |title=Insolite. Le jour où Kylian Mbappé aurait dû signer au SM Caen|trans-title=Unexpected. The day that Kylian Mbappé should have signed for SM Caen|url=https://www.ouest-france.fr/sport/football/sm-caen/monaco-manchester-city-kylian-mbappe-etait-proche-de-signer-caen-4860925 |access-date=28 May 2024 |work=[[Ouest-France]] |date=16 March 2017 |language=French}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Gaveau |first1=Claire |title=Kylian Mbappé : comment le joueur a échappé à Caen en 2012|trans-title=Kylian Mbappé: how the player escaped from Caen in 2012|url=https://www.rtl.fr/sport/football/kylian-mbappe-comment-le-joueur-a-echappe-a-caen-en-2012-7790842069 |access-date=28 May 2024 |publisher=[[RTL Group]] |date=7 November 2017 |language=French}}</ref> At age 14, he travelled to London after an invite from Chelsea, playing a match for their youth team against [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/arsene-wenger-likened-him-thierry-henry-but-who-arsenal-target-kylian-mbappe-a7565971.html |title=Arsene Wenger has likened him to Thierry Henry – but who is Arsenal target Kylian Mbappe? |date=6 February 2017 |newspaper=The Independent |access-date=31 May 2017 |archive-date=17 August 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170817084227/https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/transfers/arsene-wenger-likened-him-thierry-henry-but-who-arsenal-target-kylian-mbappe-a7565971.html |url-status=live}}</ref>

===Monaco===
In July 2013, at the age of 14, Mbappé joined the youth academy of [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]], signing a three-year contract.<ref name="youthcareer">{{cite news |date=3 September 2016 |title=Kylian Mbappe: the Monaco teen who might be Europe's most wanted youngster |website=FourFourTwo |publisher=Future |url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/sg/features/kylian-mbappe-monaco-teen-who-might-be-europes-most-wanted-youngster |access-date=23 November 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170205153728/http://www.fourfourtwo.com/sg/features/kylian-mbappe-monaco-teen-who-might-be-europes-most-wanted-youngster |archive-date=5 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Kylian Mbappé: The Monaco years |url=https://www.ligue1.com/Articles/Legends/2021/02/18/kylian-mbappe-the-monaco-years-psg |access-date=2023-08-31 |website=Ligue1 |language=en |archive-date=31 August 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230831003952/https://www.ligue1.com/Articles/Legends/2021/02/18/kylian-mbappe-the-monaco-years-psg |url-status=live }}</ref> The club had beat competition from Real Madrid and Zinedine Zidane, who was "very involved" in efforts to sign him.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Les grandes dates de la jeune carrière de Kylian Mbappé (Monaco), prêté au PSG |url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Les-grandes-dates-de-la-jeune-carriere-de-kylian-mbappe-monaco-prete-au-psg/828990 |access-date=2023-08-31 |website=L'Équipe |language=fr |archive-date=31 August 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230831003950/https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Les-grandes-dates-de-la-jeune-carriere-de-kylian-mbappe-monaco-prete-au-psg/828990 |url-status=live }}</ref>

====2015–17: Breakthrough and league title====
In October 2015, Mbappé was brought in by [[Leonardo Jardim]] to be a mainstay in Monaco's [[reserve team]], but his level of skill and maturity prompted his promotion to the main squad after just three weeks.<ref>{{Cite news |access-date=2 May 2021 |title=Mbappe: Made in Manchester |archive-url=https://archive.today/20210504204402/https://www.skysports.com/football/story-telling/11095/12292674/kylian-mbappe-back-in-manchester-the-story-of-psg-forwards-first-champions-league-goal-for-monaco-at-the-etihad-stadium |archive-date=4 May 2021 |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/story-telling/11095/12292674/kylian-mbappe-back-in-manchester-the-story-of-psg-forwards-first-champions-league-goal-for-monaco-at-the-etihad-stadium |last=Bate |first=Adam |via=Sky Sports}}</ref> He made his first team debut two months later, on 2 December 2015, in a 1–1 [[Ligue 1]] home draw against [[Stade Malherbe Caen|Caen]], replacing [[Fábio Coentrão]] after 88 minutes. Mbappé therefore became Monaco's youngest-ever first-team player, aged 16 years and 347 days, breaking the previous record set by Thierry Henry in 1994.<ref name=youthcareer/><ref name="soccerway"/>

On 20 February 2016, Mbappé scored his first goal for the club's first team, a stoppage-time goal in a 3–1 league win over [[ES Troyes AC|Troyes]] at the [[Stade Louis II]]; at the age of 17 years and 62 days, he became the youngest first-team goalscorer in Monaco's history—once again displacing Henry in the process.<ref>{{cite news |title=European round-up: What you might have missed |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35623020 |website=BBC Sport |access-date=23 February 2016 |archive-date=22 February 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160222125258/http://www.bbc.com/sport/football/35623020 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Kylian Mbappe offered Monaco contract amid Arsenal, Liverpool links |url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2814219/kylian-mbappe-offered-monaco-contract-amid-arsenal-talk |website=ESPN FC |access-date=24 February 2016 |archive-date=27 February 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160227084906/http://www.espnfc.com/story/2814219/kylian-mbappe-offered-monaco-contract-amid-arsenal-talk |url-status=live}}</ref> On 6 March 2016, Mbappé signed his first professional contract, a three-year deal, tying him to Monaco until June 2019.<ref>{{cite web |date=6 March 2019 |title=First professional contract for Kylian Mbappé |url=http://www.asmonaco.com/en/article/first-professional-contract-for-kylian-mbappe-70198.html|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160308072349/http://www.asmonaco.com/en/article/first-professional-contract-for-kylian-mbappe-70198.html|archive-date=8 March 2016|access-date=7 March 2016 |publisher=AS Monaco FC}}</ref> In an interview with [[CNN]], [[Vadim Vasilyev (businessman)|Vadim Vasilyev]], AS Monaco's vice-president, stated that he knew early on that Mbappé was a "phenomenon".<ref>{{cite news |title=Kylian Mbappe: The 'phenomenon that breathes and sleeps football' |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2018/07/13/football/kylian-mbappe-vadim-vasilyev-monaco-france-world-cup-spt-intl/index.html |publisher=CNN |access-date=14 August 2018 |archive-date=14 August 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180814233024/https://edition.cnn.com/2018/07/13/football/kylian-mbappe-vadim-vasilyev-monaco-france-world-cup-spt-intl/index.html |url-status=live}}</ref>

[[File:Mbappe.PNG|thumb|upright|Mbappé warming up for [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] in 2017]]

Mbappé scored the first [[Hat-trick (association football)|hat-trick]] of his first-team career on 14 December 2016, in a 7–0 home win over [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]] in the [[Coupe de la Ligue]] round of 16 – the first hat-trick scored by any Monaco player in the competition since [[Sonny Anderson]] in 1997.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2016/12/15/do-reported-arsenal-target-kylian-mbappe-smashes-21-year-old-rec/ |title=Reported Arsenal target Kylian Mbappe smashes 21-year-old record for Monaco |website=HITC Sport |date=15 December 2016 |access-date=29 January 2017 |archive-date=30 August 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170830102011/http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2016/12/15/do-reported-arsenal-target-kylian-mbappe-smashes-21-year-old-rec/ |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ligue1.com/coupeLigue/article/monaco-mash-rennes.htm |title=Monaco mash Rennes |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=14 December 2016 |access-date=29 January 2017 |archive-date=2 February 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170202033647/http://www.ligue1.com/coupeLigue/article/monaco-mash-rennes.htm |url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="soccerway"/> On 11 February 2017, Mbappé scored the first Ligue 1 hat-trick of his career in a 5–0 home win over [[FC Metz|Metz]]; at 18 years and two months, he became the youngest player to score a league hat-trick since [[Jérémy Ménez]] did so for [[FC Sochaux-Montbéliard|Sochaux]] back in 2005.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/article/wonderkid-mbappe-nets-hat-trick-as-monaco-march-on.htm |title=Wonderkid Mbappé nets hat-trick as Monaco march on |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=11 February 2017 |access-date=16 March 2017 |archive-date=17 March 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170317054551/http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/article/wonderkid-mbappe-nets-hat-trick-as-monaco-march-on.htm |url-status=live}}</ref> On 21 February, Mbappé scored Monaco's second goal in the 40th minute of a 5–3 loss away to Manchester City in the [[UEFA Champions League]] round of 16. It was his first European-competition goal, and he became the second-youngest French scorer in Champions League history, behind only [[Karim Benzema]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/the-new-thierry-henry-how-arsenal-transfer-target-kylian-mbappe-played-for-monaco-vs-man-city-a3472731.html |title='The new Thierry Henry' – how Arsenal transfer target Kylian Mbappe played for Monaco vs Man City |newspaper=London Evening Standard |date=22 February 2017 |access-date=5 April 2018 |archive-date=15 June 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180615164714/https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/the-new-thierry-henry-how-arsenal-transfer-target-kylian-mbappe-played-for-monaco-vs-man-city-a3472731.html |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/2017/02/24/monaco-v-man-city-champions-league-kick-off-time-team-news-and-tv-channel/1487930166558 |title=Monaco vs |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170316204824/https://www.mancity.com/news/first-team/2017/02/24/monaco-v-man-city-champions-league-kick-off-time-team-news-and-tv-channel/1487930166558 |archive-date=16 March 2017}}</ref> On 5 March, Mbappé scored two first-half goals in a 4–0 home win over [[FC Nantes|Nantes]] to bring his Ligue 1 career tally to ten goals, becoming the youngest player in the previous thirty years to reach the ten-goal mark in the league.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/article/monaco-pull-three-points-clear-with-nantes-rout.htm |title=Monaco pull three points clear with Nantes rout |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=5 March 2017 |access-date=16 March 2017 |archive-date=17 March 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170317054243/http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/article/monaco-pull-three-points-clear-with-nantes-rout.htm |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |date=5 March 2017 |title=Monaco, le nouveau record de précocité de Mbappé|trans-title=Monaco, the new record of precocity of Mbappé |url=http://www.goal.com/fr/news/29/ligue-1/2017/03/05/33340212/monaco-le-nouveau-record-de-pr%C3%A9cocit%C3%A9-de-mbapp%C3%A9|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170327172118/http://www.goal.com/fr/news/29/ligue-1/2017/03/05/33340212/monaco-le-nouveau-record-de-pr%C3%A9cocit%C3%A9-de-mbapp%C3%A9|archive-date=27 March 2017|access-date=16 March 2017 |website=Goal |publisher=Perform Group |language=fr}}</ref> On 11 March, he scored a goal in a 2–1 home win over [[FC Girondins de Bordeaux|Bordeaux]], registering his seventh goal in his previous four league starts.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/article/mbappe-and-moutinho-help-monaco-move-clear.htm |title=Mbappé and Moutinho help Monaco move clear |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |date=11 March 2017 |access-date=12 March 2017 |archive-date=11 December 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181211171127/https://www.ligue1.com/ligue1/article/mbappe-and-moutinho-help-monaco-move-clear.htm |url-status=live}}</ref>

On 15 March 2017, Mbappé scored Monaco's opening goal in the second leg of the Champions League round of 16 tie with Manchester City. Monaco went on to win 3–1, and with the aggregate score being tied 6–6, advanced to the quarter-finals thanks to the [[away goals rule]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/03/15/monaco-vs-manchester-city-champions-league-watch-live-score/ |title=Monaco 3 Manchester City 1 (agg 6–6): Pep Guardiola's side crash out on away quarter-finals against [[Borussia Dortmund]], Mbappé won a penalty and scored two goals as Monaco won the first leg 3–2 at the [[Westfalenstadion]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/apr/12/borussia-dortmund-monaco-champions-league-quarter-final-first-leg-match-report |title=Kylian Mbappe gives Monaco crucial edge against Borussia |url-status=live}}</ref> In the second leg at home, he opened the scoring as Monaco won 3–1 and advanced to the semi-finals.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Monaco 3–1 Dortmund (agg 6–3): Mbappe and Falcao send Monaco into Champions League semi-finals |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11945/10843399/monaco-3-1-dortmund-agg-6-3-mbappe-and-falcao-send-monaco-into-champions-league-semi-finals |access-date=21 August 2023 |website=Sky Sports |language=en |archive-date=21 August 2023 |url-status=live }}</ref> They were eventually eliminated from the Champions League following a 4–1 loss on aggregate to [[Juventus FC|Juventus]], with Mbappé scoring his team's lone goal in the second leg.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Dani Alves fires Juventus past Monaco into Champions League final |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/may/09/juventus-monaco-champions-league-semi-final-match-report |access-date=18 August 2023 |date=9 May 2017 |language=en |website=[[The Guardian]] |first1=Barney |last1=Ronay |archive-date=19 August 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230819005543/https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/may/09/juventus-monaco-champions-league-semi-final-match-report |url-status=live }}</ref> Mbappé ended the 2016–17 season with 26 goals from 44 matches in all competitions, as Monaco won the Ligue 1 title.<ref name="loan">{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40715851 |title=Kylian 2021 |title=Kylian Mbappé is Born to Run ===Paris Saint-Germain===
====2017–20: Record transfer and immediate success====

On 8 September 2017, Mbappé made his PSG debut in a 5–1 Ligue 1 win away at Metz, scoring a goal.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41205167 |title=Metz 1–5 Paris Saint Germain |website=BBC Sport |date=8 September 2017 |access-date=10 September 2017 |archive-date=10 September 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170910050043/http://www.bbc.com/sport/football/41205167 |url-status=live}}</ref> Four days later, he recorded his first European goal for the club in a 5–0 UEFA Champions League group stage away defeat of [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/mbappe-creates-champions-league-history-with-goal-for-psg/1fq7caitbaofg1npeqftd4n1e7 |title=Mbappe Creates Champions League History With Goal For Psg Against Celtic |website=Goal |publisher=Perform Group |date=12 September 2017 |access-date=29 September 2017 |archive-date=21 June 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180621070001/http://www.goal.com/en/news/mbappe-creates-champions-league-history-with-goal-for-psg/1fq7caitbaofg1npeqftd4n1e7 |url-status=live}}</ref> He starred in PSG's 3–0 victory over Bayern Munich in the second group game of the Champions League, setting up goals for [[Edinson Cavani]] and Neymar, the latter seeing him taking out a defender with a [[Dummy (football)|feint]] by rolling the ball under his foot.<ref name="LES">{{cite news |title=PSG 3 Bayern Munich 0: Kylian Mbappe, Edinson Cavani and Neymar star in Champions League heavyweight battle |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/psg-3-bayern-munich-0-champions-league-kylian-mbappe-edinson-cavani-neymar-star-a3645456.html |newspaper=London Evening Standard |date=30 September 2017 |access-date=30 September 2017 |archive-date=21 June 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180621070344/https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/psg-3-bayern-munich-0-champions-league-kylian-mbappe-edinson-cavani-neymar-star-a3645456.html |url-status=live}}</ref> On 6 December, Mbappé scored his tenth career Champions League goal in a 3–1 defeat to Bayern Munich, becoming the youngest player to reach that mark, at the age of 18 years and 11 months.<ref name="CL record">{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-au/news/mbappe-sets-new-champions-league-record-with-goal-against/q1o8gqd0r61m1589eq3okr0cy |title=Mbappe sets new Champions League record with goal against Bayern |website=Goal |publisher=Perform Group |access-date=1 July 2018 |archive-date=1 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180701164959/http://www.goal.com/en-au/news/mbappe-sets-new-champions-league-record-with-goal-against/q1o8gqd0r61m1589eq3okr0cy |url-status=live}}</ref> Having already won his first [[List of French football champions|league title]] with the club, on 8 May 2018, Mbappé featured in PSG's 2–0 win over [[Les Herbiers VF|Les Herbiers]] in the [[2017–18 Coupe de France|Coupe de France]] final.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/live/football/43949707 |title=French Cup final – PSG beat Les Herbiers |website=BBC Sport |first=Emlyn |last=Begley |date=8 May 2018 |access-date=11 July 2018 |archive-date=30 June 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180630151854/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/live/football/43949707 |url-status=live}}</ref>

[[File:2019-07-17 SG Dynamo Dresden vs. Paris Saint-Germain by Sandro Halank–088.jpg|thumb|Mbappé with [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]] in 2019|310x310px]]

In July 2018, Mbappé was given the number 7 jersey for the [[2018–19 Paris Saint-Germain F.C. season|upcoming season]] with PSG, taking up the squad number left vacant by [[Lucas Moura]].<ref name="number 7">{{cite news |first=Jonathan |last=Johnson |title=Kylian Mbappe gets No. 7 shirt in new-look Paris Saint-Germain kit |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/blog/the-toe-poke/65/post/3575253/kylian-mbappe-gets-no7-shirt-in-new-look-paris-saint-germain-kit |access-date=27 July 2018 |date=26 July 2018 |publisher=ESPN |archive-date=4 August 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180804224034/http://www.espn.co.uk/football/blog/the-toe-poke/65/post/3575253/kylian-mbappe-gets-no7-shirt-in-new-look-paris-saint-germain-kit |url-status=live}}</ref> Sporting the hashtag #K7LIAN, Mbappé stated, "I keep trying to progress on the pitch and I think that, for me, it was the right time to change number. It is something of an affirmation. The No. 7 shirt is a legendary one and many greats have worn it. I hope that I will be able to do this number justice on the pitch."<ref name="number 7"/>

In his first appearance of the season, Mbappé scored twice in the last 10 minutes as PSG won 3–1 against [[En Avant de Guingamp|Guingamp]] in Ligue 1.<ref>{{cite news |title=Mbappe scores twice in Lique 1 return to seal PSG fight-back |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45228476 |access-date=18 August 2018 |website=BBC Sport |archive-date=14 September 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180914220400/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45228476 |url-status=live}}</ref> In the following league game, the front three of Mbappé, Cavani and Neymar all scored in a 3–1 win over [[Angers SCO|Angers]] at home, with Mbappé – starting his first game of the season – scoring from a [[volley (association football)|volley]] and setting up Neymar to score the third.<ref>{{cite news |title=Cavani, Mbappe & Neymar all score as PSG maintain 100% start |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45310948 |access-date=26 August 2018 |website=BBC Sport |archive-date=26 August 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180826195519/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45310948 |url-status=live}}</ref> On 1 September, he scored and assisted in a 4–2 away win over [[Nîmes Olympique|Nîmes]], but was sent off for the first time in his career with a straight [[Red card (association football)|red card]] in injury time, after shoving [[Téji Savanier]] in retaliation for a late challenge from behind, for which Savanier was also sent off.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/mbappe-after-red-card-i-would-do-it-again |title=Mbappe after red card: I would do it again |website=FourFourTwo |publisher=Future |date=2 September 2018 |access-date=2 September 2018 |archive-date=2 September 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180902220623/https://www.fourfourtwo.com/news/mbappe-after-red-card-i-would-do-it-again |url-status=live}}</ref> Regarding his sending-off, Mbappé told reporters after the match, "If I had the chance to do it over again, I would do the same thing. I will apologise to [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C. supporters|the supporters]] and everybody, but I cannot tolerate this sort of thing."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/paris-saint-germain/story/3620504/psgs-kylian-mbappe-doesnt-regret-red-card-i-would-do-the-same-thing?src=com |title=PSG's Kylian Mbappe doesn't regret red card: 'I would do the same thing' |publisher=ESPN |first=Jonathan |last=Johnson |date=2 September 2018 |access-date=2 September 2018 |archive-date=2 September 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180902220725/http://www.espn.com/soccer/paris-saint-germain/story/3620504/psgs-kylian-mbappe-doesnt-regret-red-card-i-would-do-the-same-thing?src=com |url-status=live}}</ref> On 8 October, Mbappé scored four goals in just 13 minutes in a 5–0 home victory over [[Olympique Lyonnais|Lyon]] and became the youngest player (at 19 years and 9 months) to score four goals in one game in Ligue 1 over the last forty-five seasons.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/mbappe-breaks-45-year-ligue-1-record-in-psg-rout/d060mjliyvxe1usjx8kja4jrg |title=Mbappe breaks 45-year Ligue 1 record in PSG rout |website=Goal |publisher=Perform Group |access-date=8 October 2018 |archive-date=8 October 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181008174859/http://www.goal.com/en/news/mbappe-breaks-45-year-ligue-1-record-in-psg-rout/d060mjliyvxe1usjx8kja4jrg |url-status=live}}</ref> On 3 December, Mbappé was the inaugural winner of the [[Kopa Trophy]], which is awarded by ''[[France Football]]'' to the best under-21 player in the world.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/dec/03/ballon-dor-ada-hegerberg-twerk-luka-modric |title=Ada Hegerberg: first women's Ballon d'Or marred as winner is asked to twerk |newspaper=The Guardian |first=Ed |last=Aarons |date=4 December 2018 |access-date=4 December 2018 |archive-date=23 October 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191023002409/https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/dec/03/ballon-dor-ada-hegerberg-twerk-luka-modric |url-status=live}}</ref>

On 19 January 2019, Mbappé was one of two players (the other being Cavani) to score a hat-trick in a 9–0 win over Guingamp, breaking a record PSG had set the previous season.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46935009 |title=Paris St-Germain 9–0 Guingamp |website=BBC Sport |date=19 January 2019 |access-date=23 January 2019 |archive-date=23 January 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190123224144/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46935009 |url-status=live}}</ref> On 12 February, he scored a goal in a 2–0 win over [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] at [[Old Trafford]] in the Champions League round of 16.<ref>{{cite web |date=12 February 2019 |title=Man. United 0–2 Paris |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/match/2026849--man-united-vs-paris/ |access-date=23 February 2022 |publisher=UEFA |archive-date=24 October 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201024041309/https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/match/2026849--man-united-vs-paris/ |url-status=live }}</ref> On 2 March, he scored twice in a 2–1 away win over Caen to reach his 50th goal with the club.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/47417301 |title=Caen 1–2 Paris Saint Germain |website=BBC Sport |date=2 March 2019 |access-date=3 March 2019 |archive-date=25 April 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190425121108/https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/47417301 |url-status=live}}</ref> On 6 March, PSG lost 3–1 at home against Manchester United and was subsequently knocked out from the Champions League on the away goals rule.<ref>{{cite web |date=6 March 2021 |title=Paris 1–3 Man. United |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/match/2026859--paris-vs-man-united/?referrer=%2Fuefachampionsleague%2Fseason%3D2019%2Fmatches%2Fround%3D2000981%2Fmatch%3D2026859%2Findex |access-date=23 February 2022 |publisher=UEFA |archive-date=24 May 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210524094131/https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/match/2026859--paris-vs-man-united/?referrer=%2Fuefachampionsleague%2Fseason%3D2019%2Fmatches%2Fround%3D2000981%2Fmatch%3D2026859%2Findex |url-status=live }}</ref> On 21 April, he scored a hat-trick in a 3–1 win against Monaco, netting his first goals against his former club.<ref>{{cite web |date=21 April 2019 |title=Mbappe nets hat trick, Neymar returns as PSG beat Monaco on title-clinching day |url=https://www.espn.com/soccer/report?gameId=512061 |access-date=23 February 2022 |publisher=ESPN |archive-date=22 April 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190422141940/http://www.espn.com/soccer/report?gameId=512061 |url-status=live }}</ref> PSG finished the season as Ligue 1 champions,<ref name="ligue1history">{{cite web |date=24 May 2019 |title=Mbappe ensures PSG make Ligue 1 history despite defeat |url=https://www.foxsportsasia.com/football/ligue-1/1104487/mbappe-ensures-psg-make-ligue-1-history-despite-defeat/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190525140939/https://www.foxsportsasia.com/football/ligue-1/1104487/mbappe-ensures-psg-make-ligue-1-history-despite-defeat/ |archive-date=25 May 2019 |access-date=25 May 2019 |website=Fox Sports Asia}}</ref> with Mbappé winning the [[Ligue 1 Player of the Year|Player of the Year]] award,<ref name="UNFP">{{cite news |date=19 May 2019 |title=Mbappé wins awards double |url=https://www.ligue1.com/Articles/NEWS/2020/03/14/mbappe-wins-awards-double |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210603092953/https://www.ligue1.com/Articles/NEWS/2020/03/14/mbappe-wins-awards-double |archive-date=3 June 2021 |access-date=20 May 2019 |publisher=Ligue 1}}</ref> while also finishing the season as the [[2018–19 Ligue 1#Top goalscorers|top goalscorer]] with 33 goals.<ref name="ligue1history" />

[[File:2019-07-17 SG Dynamo Dresden vs. Paris Saint-Germain by Sandro Halank–616.jpg|thumb|right|Mbappé playing against Dynamo Dresden in July 2019|272x272px]]

On 3 August, Mbappé scored in a 2–1 win over Rennes to capture his first title of the 2019–20 season, the [[2019 Trophée des Champions|Trophée des Champions]].<ref name="2019TDC"/> He then scored again in PSG's opening Ligue 1 match of the season, a 3–0 home win over Nîmes on 11 August.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/49314946 |title=Paris Saint Germain 3–0 Nîmes |website=BBC Sport |date=11 August 2019 |access-date=23 October 2019 |archive-date=12 August 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190812222052/https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/49314946 |url-status=live}}</ref> On 22 October, he came off the bench and scored a [[perfect hat-trick]] in a 5–0 away win over Belgian side [[Club Brugge KV|Club Brugge]] in the Champions League;<ref>{{cite web |date=23 October 2019 |title=Kylian Mbappe: PSG forward sets another Champions League record with 'perfect' substitute hat-trick |url=https://www.squawka.com/en/news/kylian-mbappe-perfect-hat-trick-champions-league-manarama-prostate-cancer |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201012023625/https://www.squawka.com/en/kylian-mbappe-perfect-hat-trick-champions-league-manarama-prostate-cancer/ |archive-date=12 October 2020 |access-date=19 January 2020 |website=Squawka |publisher=Catena Media}}</ref> at the age of 20 years and 306 days, he became the youngest player ever to score at least 15 goals in the competition.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/49874401 |title=Club Bruges 0–5 Paris Saint Germain |website=BBC Sport |date=22 October 2019 |access-date=23 October 2019 |archive-date=24 October 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191024235415/https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/49874401 |url-status=live}}</ref>

On 1 May 2020, PSG were crowned Ligue 1 champions after the season had been called off amid the [[COVID-19 pandemic in France|COVID-19 pandemic]]; at the time of the league's premature suspension, PSG were in first place, with a twelve–point lead over second–placed [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2020/apr/30/psg-awarded-ligue-1-title-after-season-stopped-by-coronavirus-crisis |title=PSG awarded Ligue 1 title and two teams are relegated after season is scrapped |newspaper=The Guardian |date=30 April 2020 |access-date=13 June 2020 |archive-date=13 June 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200613025740/https://www.theguardian.com/football/2020/apr/30/psg-awarded-ligue-1-title-after-season-stopped-by-coronavirus-crisis |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11820/11981197/paris-saint-germain-crowned-ligue-1-champions-after-french-season-called-off |title=Paris Saint-Germain crowned Ligue 1 champions after French season called off |website=Sky Sports |date=1 May 2020 |access-date=31 May 2020 |archive-date=1 July 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200701213126/https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11820/11981197/paris-saint-germain-crowned-ligue-1-champions-after-french-season-called-off |url-status=live}}</ref> Mbappé finished the 2019–20 season as joint-top scorer in Ligue 1 with 18 goals, along with Monaco's [[Wissam Ben Yedder]]; however, Mbappé was assigned the title due to his higher goals-per-game ratio.<ref name="2019–20 Ligue 1 top scorer">{{cite web |date=1 May 2020 |title=Kylian Mbappé and Angel Di Maria: top scorer and top assist provider |url=https://en.psg.fr/teams/first-team/content/kylian-mbappe-and-angel-di-maria-top-scorer-and-top-assist-provider |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200611084210/https://en.psg.fr/teams/first-team/content/kylian-mbappe-and-angel-di-maria-top-scorer-and-top-assist-provider |archive-date=11 June 2020 |access-date=1 May 2020 |publisher=Paris Saint-Germain F.C.}}</ref> On 24 July, in the [[2020 Coupe de France final|Coupe de France final]] against [[AS Saint-Étienne|Saint-Étienne]], Mbappé was forced off after sustaining an injury following a challenge from [[Loïc Perrin]], who was sent off; PSG won the match 1–0,<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.si.com/soccer/2020/07/24/kylian-mbappe-ankle-injury-psg-coupe-de-france-title |title=Mbappe Injury Overshadows PSG's Coupe De France Title |magazine=Sports Illustrated |date=24 July 2020 |access-date=24 August 2020 |archive-date=1 August 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200801164344/https://www.si.com/soccer/2020/07/24/kylian-mbappe-ankle-injury-psg-coupe-de-france-title |url-status=live}}</ref> although Mbappé was ruled out of the [[2020 Coupe de la Ligue final|Coupe de la Ligue final]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.beinsports.com/en/uefa-champions-league/news/psg-forward-mbappe-out-of-champions-league-qu/1512491 |title=PSG forward Mbappe out of Champions League quarter-final against Atalanta |publisher=beIN SPORTS |date=27 July 2020 |access-date=24 August 2020 |archive-date=31 July 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200731070524/https://www.beinsports.com/en/uefa-champions-league/news/psg-forward-mbappe-out-of-champions-league-qu/1512491 |url-status=live}}</ref> which PSG went on to win, completing a domestic [[treble (association football)|treble]].<ref>{{cite web |date=11 August 2020 |title=Mbappe training return boosts PSG for Atalanta quarterfinal |url=https://www.sportsnet.ca/soccer/mbappe-training-return-boosts-psg-atalanta-quarterfinal/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200829060433/https://www.sportsnet.ca/soccer/mbappe-training-return-boosts-psg-atalanta-quarterfinal/|archive-date=29 August 2020|access-date=24 August 2020 |website=Sportsnet}}</ref> He returned to action in the Champions League quarter-final against [[Atalanta BC|Atalanta]] on 12 August, coming on a substitute, and assisting [[Eric Maxim Choupo-Moting]]'s match–winning goal in injury time.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://en.as.com/en/2020/08/12/football/1597255022_750607.html |title=Atalanta dealt cruelest of exits by PSG late show |publisher=AS.com |date=13 August 2020 |access-date=24 August 2020 |archive-date=29 August 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200829055041/https://en.as.com/en/2020/08/12/football/1597255022_750607.html |url-status=live}}</ref> PSG eventually suffered a 1–0 loss to Bayern Munich in the [[2020 UEFA Champions League final|Champions League final]] on 23 August.<ref name="CL 2020">{{cite web |url=https://www.espn.com/soccer/report?gameId=573698 |title=Bayern Munich beat Paris Saint-Germain to win Champions League |publisher=ESPN |date=23 August 2020|access-date=23 August 2020|archive-date=31 August 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200831175653/https://www.espn.com/soccer/report?gameId=573698|url-status=live}}</ref>

====2020–22: Further triumphs and contract extension====
Mbappé missed the first three matches of the season after contracting [[COVID-19]] while being on international duty.<ref name=":2">{{cite news |last=Dotson |first=Kevin |date=7 September 2020 |title=Kylian Mbappe tests positive for Covid-19 while playing with France |url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/07/football/kylian-mbappe-covid-test-spt-intl/index.html|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200910085351/https://www.cnn.com/2020/09/07/football/kylian-mbappe-covid-test-spt-intl/index.html|archive-date=10 September 2020|access-date=30 September 2020 |publisher=CNN}}</ref> He returned to action on 20 September 2020, in a 3–0 away win against [[OGC Nice|Nice]], and scored a goal from a penalty kick.<ref>{{cite web |date=20 September 2020 |title=Nice 0–3 Paris Saint-Germain |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/54226147|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201012023627/https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/54226147|archive-date=12 October 2020|access-date=30 September 2020 |website=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 28 October, Mbappé recorded two assists, both for [[Moise Kean]], in a 2–0 Champions League group stage victory against [[İstanbul Başakşehir F.K.|İstanbul Başakşehir]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Kean at the double as PSG beat Basaksehir 2–0 |url=https://in.reuters.com/article/soccer-champions-iba-psg-report-idINKBN27E0OR |date=28 October 2020 |access-date=3 November 2020 |work=Reuters |archive-date=25 November 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201125051746/https://in.reuters.com/article/soccer-champions-iba-psg-report-idINKBN27E0OR |url-status=live }}</ref> In doing so, he became the player with the most assists in the competition since the beginning of the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League|2017–18 edition]], with his tally adding up to fourteen over the four seasons.<ref>{{cite web |last=Zavala |first=Steve |date=29 October 2020 |title=Mbappe Has Recorded the Most Champions League Assists Since 2017 |url=https://psgtalk.com/2020/10/mbappe-has-recorded-the-most-champions-league-assists-since-2017/ |access-date=3 November 2020 |website=PSG Talk |archive-date=10 December 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201210022213/https://psgtalk.com/2020/10/mbappe-has-recorded-the-most-champions-league-assists-since-2017/ |url-status=live }}</ref> In a Ligue 1 match against [[Montpellier HSC|Montpellier]] on 5 December, Mbappé scored his 100th goal for PSG, becoming only the fifth player to achieve the feat for the Parisian club.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.goal.com/en-us/news/mbappe-reaches-100-goals-for-psg-with-strike-against/36xw7k3xgagd1gf16xb9cc6xn |title=Mbappe reaches 100 goals for PSG with strike against Montpellier |website=Goal |last=Keble |first=Alex |date=5 December 2020 |access-date=5 December 2020 |archive-date=25 January 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210125163435/https://www.goal.com/en-us/news/mbappe-reaches-100-goals-for-psg-with-strike-against/36xw7k3xgagd1gf16xb9cc6xn |url-status=live }}</ref> In his side's final Champions League group match, Mbappé scored his first two goals of the European campaign against Başakşehir, as PSG won 5–1 and qualified for the [[2020–21 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|knockout phase]] as group winners.<ref>{{Cite news |last= |first= |title=PSG beat Istanbul Basaksehir in match delayed due to alleged racist incident |work= The New York Times|url=https://theathletic.com/4229469/2020/12/09/psg-beat-istanbul-basaksehir-in-match-delayed-due-to-alleged-racist-incident/ |access-date=21 August 2023 |language=en |archive-date=21 August 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230821053337/https://theathletic.com/4229469/2020/12/09/psg-beat-istanbul-basaksehir-in-match-delayed-due-to-alleged-racist-incident/ |url-status=live }}</ref> He also became the youngest player in Champions League history to reach twenty goals (although this record would then be surpassed by [[Erling Haaland]] later on in the same season).<ref>{{cite news |date=20 December 2020 |title=PSG star Mbappe overtakes Messi to become youngest player to reach 20 Champions League goals |url=https://www.goal.com/en/news/psg-star-mbappe-overtakes-messi-to-become-youngest-player-to/iv3npfnrozd71m9ymtl13900q |access-date=20 December 2020 |website=Goal |archive-date=10 December 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201210193545/https://www.goal.com/en/news/psg-star-mbappe-overtakes-messi-to-become-youngest-player-to/iv3npfnrozd71m9ymtl13900q |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |date=10 March 2021 |title=Just how good are Kylian Mbappé and Erling Haaland? |publisher=UEFA |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/0266-1199ef3658d5-145c6798f795-1000--haaland-nears-mbappe-record/ |access-date=12 March 2021 |archive-date=18 March 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210318000530/https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/0266-1199ef3658d5-145c6798f795-1000--haaland-nears-mbappe-record/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

On 16 February 2021, Mbappé became only the third player, after [[Faustino Asprilla]] and [[Andriy Shevchenko]], to score a [[List of UEFA Champions League hat-tricks|Champions League hat-trick]] against [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]], doing so in PSG's 4–1 round of 16 win at the [[Camp Nou]].<ref>{{cite web |date=16 February 2021 |title=Barcelona 1–4 Paris: Mbappé hits stunning hat-trick |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/match/2029477--barcelona-vs-paris/postmatch/report/ |access-date=16 February 2021 |publisher=UEFA |archive-date=16 February 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210216235213/https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/match/2029477--barcelona-vs-paris/postmatch/report/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Mbappé's hat-trick also saw him overtake [[Pauleta]]'s total of 109 goals to become PSG's [[List of Paris Saint-Germain F.C. records and statistics#All-time top scorers|third-highest scorer]], with only Cavani (200 goals) and [[Zlatan Ibrahimović]] (156 goals) getting more for the club.<ref>{{cite news |date=18 February 2021 |title=Champions League hits and misses: Kylian Mbappe puts Lionel Messi in the shade, Liverpool return to form |website=Sky Sports |url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/12220162/champions-league-hits-and-misses-kylian-mbappe-puts-lionel-messi-in-the-shade-liverpool-return-to-form |access-date=17 February 2021 |archive-date=17 February 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210217140644/https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11095/12220162/champions-league-hits-and-misses-kylian-mbappe-puts-lionel-messi-in-the-shade-liverpool-return-to-form |url-status=live }}</ref> On 27 February, Mbappé scored twice in a 4–0 away win against [[Dijon FCO|Dijon]], becoming the first player to score five braces in the Ligue 1 season.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Dijon 0–4 PSG: Mbappe scores twice as PSG beat bottom side |website=BBC Sport |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/56224662 |date=27 February 2021 |access-date=1 March 2021 |archive-date=28 February 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210228001024/https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/56224662 |url-status=live }}</ref> In the second leg against Barcelona on 10 March, Mbappé scored from the spot in a 1–1 draw at the Parc de Princes, as his side advanced to the quarter-finals 5–2 on aggregate.<ref>{{cite web |date=10 March 2021 |title=Paris 1–1 Barcelona (agg: 5–2): Mbappé seals hosts' progress |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/match/2029483--paris-vs-barcelona/postmatch/report/ |access-date=13 March 2021 |publisher=UEFA |archive-date=16 March 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210316000111/https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/match/2029483--paris-vs-barcelona/postmatch/report/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Mbappé's penalty was his 25th Champions League goal, surpassing opponent Lionel Messi as the youngest player to reach this milestone, at 22 years and 80 days. Adding to his hat-trick from the first leg, Mbappé additionally became the first player to score four goals against Barcelona in a single Champions League season.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.goal.com/en/amp/news/mbappe-breaks-messi-record-youngest-player-25-champions/18w9p5utul9ax16itdzs62do8e |title=Mbappe breaks Messi record as PSG star becomes youngest player to reach 25 Champions League goals |website=Goal |date=10 March 2021 |access-date=12 March 2021 |archive-date=16 March 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210316102938/https://www.goal.com/en/amp/news/mbappe-breaks-messi-record-youngest-player-25-champions/18w9p5utul9ax16itdzs62do8e |url-status=live }}</ref>

In the first leg of the Champions League quarter-final against Bayern Munich on 7 April, Mbappé scored two goals, helping his team to a 3–2 win at the [[Allianz Arena]], PSG's first victory in [[Munich]] since 1994.<ref>{{cite web|title='I am not here to hide' – PSG star Mbappe delighted with Champions League match-winning double at Bayern Munich {{!}} Goal.com|url=https://www.goal.com/en-us/news/i-am-not-here-to-hide-psg-mbappe-bayern-munich/8jqc9ld487x0145a9etxu84bi|access-date=10 April 2021|website=Goal|archive-date=10 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210410161940/https://www.goal.com/en-us/news/i-am-not-here-to-hide-psg-mbappe-bayern-munich/8jqc9ld487x0145a9etxu84bi|url-status=live}}</ref> The French club later progressed to the semi-finals to be eventually eliminated by Manchester City: the forward missed the second leg due to a calf injury.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://theathletic.com/news/kylian-mbappe-injury-psg-city-latest/ayacruXrNsWB |title=Kylian Mbappe travels with PSG squad ahead of City game amid injury doubts |website=The Athletic |date=3 May 2021 |access-date=24 May 2021 |archive-date=5 May 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210505233906/https://theathletic.com/news/kylian-mbappe-injury-psg-city-latest/ayacruXrNsWB |url-status=live }}</ref> On 19 May, Mbappé scored once and assisted the second in the [[2021 Coupe de France final|Coupe de France final]] against his former club Monaco, as PSG won 2–0 to claim their first major trophy of the season.<ref>{{Cite news |title=PSG beat Monaco to win French Cup |website=BBC Sport |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/57177755 |access-date=26 May 2021 |archive-date=27 May 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210527045704/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/57177755 |url-status=live }}</ref> He ended the Ligue 1 campaign with 27 goals, becoming the top scorer for the third consecutive season, although PSG missed out on the Ligue 1 title – it was the first time in Mbappé's career where he did not win the league after four consecutive successes.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.sportsmax.tv/index.php/football/international/item/82483-everyone-has-seen-mbappe-challenges-board-to-act-on-psg-s-shortcomings |title=Everyone has seen – Mbappe challenges board to act on PSG's shortcomings |website=sportsmax.tv |date=23 May 2021 |access-date=24 May 2021 |archive-date=24 May 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210524000351/https://www.sportsmax.tv/index.php/football/international/item/82483-everyone-has-seen-mbappe-challenges-board-to-act-on-psg-s-shortcomings |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |date=23 May 2021 |title=Lille end PSG dominance to win Ligue 1 title |url=https://www.espn.com/soccer/lille/story/4385476/lille-end-psg-dominance-to-win-ligue-1-title-for-first-time-in-10-years |access-date=26 May 2021 |publisher=ESPN |archive-date=26 May 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210526111629/https://www.espn.com/soccer/lille/story/4385476/lille-end-psg-dominance-to-win-ligue-1-title-for-first-time-in-10-years |url-status=live }}</ref> Mbappé ended the season by receiving the Ligue 1 Player of the Year award and being included in the Ligue 1 Team of the Season.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://en.as.com/en/2021/05/23/football/1621806897_609271.html |title=Kylian Mbappé gives some clues to his future club |website=AS |date=23 May 2021 |access-date=26 May 2021 |archive-date=26 May 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210526164917/https://en.as.com/en/2021/05/23/football/1621806897_609271.html |url-status=dead }}</ref>

[[File:Mbappe Messi Neymar.jpg|thumb|right|''Left-to-right:'' Mbappé, [[Lionel Messi|Messi]] and [[Neymar]] playing against [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]] in [[Le Classique]], October 2021|250x250px]]

On 14 August 2021, prior to Paris Saint-Germain's opening home match of the [[2021–22 Paris Saint-Germain F.C. season|2021–22 season]] against [[RC Strasbourg Alsace|Strasbourg]], Mbappé was booed by the [[Parc des Princes]] amidst rumours that he wanted to sign for Spanish club Real Madrid.<ref>{{cite web |last=Bienkowski |first=Stefan |date=14 August 2021 |title=Mbappe booed ahead of PSG game as Madrid rumours intensify |url=https://www.footballtransfers.com/en/transfer-news/fr-ligue-1/2021/08/mbappe-booed-ahead-psg-game-madrid-rumours-intensify |access-date=8 January 2022 |website=FootballTransfers |archive-date=14 November 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221114111058/https://www.footballtransfers.com/en/transfer-news/fr-ligue-1/2021/08/mbappe-booed-ahead-psg-game-madrid-rumours-intensify |url-status=live }}</ref> The match ended in a 4–2 victory for the Parisians, with the forward setting up three of his team's goals.<ref>{{cite web |date=14 August 2021 |title=Messi presented to crowd before PSG beat Strasbourg |url=https://www.ligue1.com/Articles/MATCH-REPORTS/2021/08/14/messi-presented-crowd-psg-beat-strasbourg-mbappe-neymar-icardi |access-date=8 January 2022 |publisher=Ligue 1 |archive-date=29 July 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220729005804/https://www.ligue1.com/Articles/MATCH-REPORTS/2021/08/14/messi-presented-crowd-psg-beat-strasbourg-mbappe-neymar-icardi |url-status=live }}</ref> He scored his first goal of the season in a 4–2 away win against [[Stade Brestois 29|Brest]] six days later.<ref>{{cite web |last=Ridge |first=Patric |date=21 August 2021 |title=Brest 2–4 Paris Saint-Germain: Mbappe up and running as Messi wait continues |url=https://www.mykhel.com/football/kylian-mbappe-scores-first-goal-of-season-as-paris-saint-germain-defeat-brest-lionel-messi-173117.html |access-date=8 January 2022 |website=myKhel |archive-date=30 July 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220730093604/https://www.mykhel.com/football/kylian-mbappe-scores-first-goal-of-season-as-paris-saint-germain-defeat-brest-lionel-messi-173117.html |url-status=live }}</ref> In the following match against Reims on 29 August, in which Lionel Messi notably made his debut for PSG, Mbappé scored a brace in a 2–0 ''Rouge-et-Bleu'' victory.<ref>{{cite web |last=Chiari |first=Mike |date=29 August 2021 |title=Lionel Messi Debuts as Kylian Mbappe Scores Twice in PSG's Win vs. Stade de Reims |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/10011268-lionel-messi-debuts-as-kylian-mbappe-scores-twice-in-psgs-win-vs-stade-de-reims |access-date=8 January 2022 |website=Bleacher Report |archive-date=30 July 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220730030441/https://bleacherreport.com/articles/10011268-lionel-messi-debuts-as-kylian-mbappe-scores-twice-in-psgs-win-vs-stade-de-reims |url-status=live }}</ref> On 24 November, he scored in a 2–1 Champions League defeat to Manchester City at the [[City of Manchester Stadium]].<ref>{{cite web |date=24 November 2021 |title=Man City come from behind to beat PSG as Gabriel Jesus nets late winner |url=https://www.espn.com/soccer/report/_/gameId/618715 |access-date=16 February 2022 |publisher=ESPN |archive-date=28 July 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220728201801/https://www.espn.com/soccer/report/_/gameId/618715 |url-status=live }}</ref> On 7 December, he scored two goals in a 4–1 Champions League home win over Club Brugge. The goals, which were his 30th and 31st in the Champions League, made him the youngest player to reach this milestone in the history of the competition.<ref>{{cite web |date=7 December 2021 |title=Kylian Mbappé's stunning stats after Brugge |url=https://en.psg.fr/teams/first-team/content/kylian-mbappes-stunning-stats-after-brugge-paris-saint-germain-brugge-psg-ucl |access-date=16 February 2022 |publisher=Paris Saint-Germain F.C. |archive-date=29 July 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220729011341/https://en.psg.fr/teams/first-team/content/kylian-mbappes-stunning-stats-after-brugge-paris-saint-germain-brugge-psg-ucl |url-status=live }}</ref>

On 12 December 2021, Mbappé scored twice against Monaco in Ligue 1 to reach a [[List of Paris Saint-Germain F.C. records and statistics#Top scorers in Ligue 1|century of league goals for PSG]]. At 22 years and 357 days old, he became the youngest player to score 100 goals for a single team in the French top-flight since [[Opta Sports|Opta]] began recording data in the [[1950–51 French Division 1|1950–51 season]].<ref>{{cite news |title='I give everything I have' – Mbappe becomes the youngest player to goalscoring mark with 100th PSG goal |url=https://www.goal.com/en-us/news/i-give-everything-i-have-mbappe-becomes-the-youngest-player/blt984823dd1fad7c21 |access-date=13 December 2021 |website=Goal |archive-date=26 November 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221126235720/https://www.goal.com/en-us/news/i-give-everything-i-have-mbappe-becomes-the-youngest-player/blt984823dd1fad7c21 |url-status=live }}</ref> On 3 January 2022, Mbappé scored his first hat-trick of the season in a 4–0 Coupe de France win over [[Vannes OC|Vannes]].<ref>{{cite web |date=4 January 2022 |title=Mbappe hat trick as PSG beats Vannes 4–0 in French Cup |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/sports/football/mbappe-hat-trick-as-psg-beats-vannes-4-0-in-french-cup-7705011/ |access-date=16 February 2022 |website=Indian Express Limited |archive-date=28 July 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220728200810/https://indianexpress.com/article/sports/football/mbappe-hat-trick-as-psg-beats-vannes-4-0-in-french-cup-7705011/ |url-status=live }}</ref> On 11 February, he scored the winning goal in stoppage time in a 1–0 league win over Rennes,<ref>{{cite web |date=11 February 2022 |title=Kylian Mbappe nets late winner as PSG down Stade Rennais |url=https://www.espn.com/soccer/report?gameId=609297 |access-date=16 February 2022 |publisher=ESPN |archive-date=28 July 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220728202305/https://www.espn.com/soccer/report?gameId=609297 |url-status=live }}</ref> a feat he repeated four days later, in a 1–0 Champions League victory over Real Madrid in the first leg of the round of 16.<ref>{{cite news |last=Church |first=Ben |date=16 February 2022 |title=Champions League: Kylian Mbappe scores last-gasp winner against Real Madrid after Lionel Messi misses penalty for PSG |url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/02/15/football/psg-real-madrid-champions-league-round-16-spt-intl/index.html |access-date=16 February 2022 |publisher=CNN |archive-date=28 July 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220728200810/https://www.cnn.com/2022/02/15/football/psg-real-madrid-champions-league-round-16-spt-intl/index.html |url-status=live }}</ref> He scored another goal in the second leg, making him the second-highest goalscorer in Paris Saint-Germain's history; however, his team was knocked out following a 3–1 defeat at the [[Santiago Bernabéu Stadium]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.101greatgoals.com/top-stories/how-kylian-mbappe-set-a-new-record-with-his-goal-over-real-madrid/ |title=How Kylian Mbappe set a new record with his goal over Real Madrid |access-date=9 March 2022 |date=9 March 2022 |last1=Browning |first1=Ben |website=101 Great Goals |archive-date=22 September 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220922203224/https://www.101greatgoals.com/top-stories/how-kylian-mbappe-set-a-new-record-with-his-goal-over-real-madrid/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2022/mar/09/after-mbappes-illumination-paris-again-becomes-the-city-of-dying-light |title=After Mbappé's illumination, Paris again becomes the city of dying light |access-date=9 March 2022 |date=9 March 2022 |last1=Ronay |first1=Barney |newspaper=The Guardian |archive-date=8 September 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220908133633/https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2022/mar/09/after-mbappes-illumination-paris-again-becomes-the-city-of-dying-light |url-status=live }}</ref>

On 21 May 2022, Mbappé extended his contract with PSG until 2025,<ref>{{cite web |date=21 May 2022 |title=Kylian Mbappé extends contract with Paris Saint-Germain until 2025 |url=https://en.psg.fr/teams/first-team/content/kylian-mbappe-extends-contract-with-paris-saint-germain-until-2025 |access-date=21 May 2022 |publisher=Paris Saint-Germain F.C. |archive-date=11 October 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221011183825/https://en.psg.fr/teams/first-team/content/kylian-mbappe-extends-contract-with-paris-saint-germain-until-2025 |url-status=live }}</ref> despite speculations of a possible transfer to Real Madrid,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2022/may/21/kylian-mbappe-decides-to-stay-at-psg-instead-of-joining-real-madrid|title=Kylian Mbappé decides to stay at PSG instead of joining Real Madrid|newspaper=The Guardian|first1=Ed|last1=Aarons|first2=Fabrizio|last2=Romano|date=21 May 2022|access-date=21 May 2022|archive-date=21 November 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221121144217/https://www.theguardian.com/football/2022/may/21/kylian-mbappe-decides-to-stay-at-psg-instead-of-joining-real-madrid|url-status=live}}</ref> which prompted [[La Liga]] officials to file a complaint to [[UEFA]] regarding accumulating losses of PSG in the previous years.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.laliga.com/noticias/nota-informativa-sobre-el-posible-anuncio-de-mbappe-de-permanecer-en-el-psg |title=Nota informativa: Sobre el posible anuncio de Mbappé de permanecer en el PSG |publisher=La Liga |language=es |date=21 May 2022 |access-date=21 May 2022 |archive-date=29 July 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220729010055/https://www.laliga.com/noticias/nota-informativa-sobre-el-posible-anuncio-de-mbappe-de-permanecer-en-el-psg |url-status=live }}</ref> Mbappé himself reportedly called and spoke to Real Madrid's president [[Florentino Pérez]], telling him that he would not be signing for Real Madrid.<ref>{{cite web |date=23 May 2022 |title=Kylian Mbappé denies signing PSG deal to gain power over club decisions |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2022/may/23/kylian-mbappe-denies-signing-psg-deal-to-gain-power-over-club-decisions |access-date=26 May 2022 |newspaper=The Guardian |first=Michael |last=Butler |archive-date=27 November 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221127143625/https://www.theguardian.com/football/2022/may/23/kylian-mbappe-denies-signing-psg-deal-to-gain-power-over-club-decisions |url-status=live }}</ref> According to [[Sky Sports]], the financial details of Mbappé's contract included a monthly wage of £4 million, making him the highest-paid player in the world.<ref name=":1">{{cite news |title=Kylian Mbappe: PSG forward agrees contract extension with Ligue 1 champions |url=https://uk-sport-web.prod.oceanusorigin.com/football/news/12040/12617361/kylian-mbappe-psg-forward-agrees-contract-extension-with-ligue-1-champions |access-date=26 May 2022 |website=Sky Sports }}{{Dead link|date=June 2023 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Mbappé and PSG also reportedly secured a signing-on figure in the region of £100 million.<ref name=":1" /> In the hours following the forward's contract extension, he scored a hat-trick in a 5–0 win over Metz, to finish the season with 28 goals as top scorer for the fourth consecutive season.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/61537573 |title=Paris Saint Germain 5–0 Metz |website=BBC Sport |date=21 May 2022 |access-date=21 May 2022 |archive-date=15 August 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220815180927/https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/61537573 |url-status=live }}</ref> He became the third player to finish as Ligue 1's top scorer for four seasons in a row. Mbappé also provided 17 assists in the season, becoming the first player to finish as both top scorer and top assist provider in the league's history.<ref name=":3">{{cite web |date=21 May 2022 |title=Kylian Mbappé, une saison historique |trans-title=Kylian Mbappé, a historical season |url=https://www.ligue1.fr/Articles/ACTU/2022/05/21/kylian-mbappe-une-saison-historique |access-date=21 May 2022 |publisher=Ligue 1 |language=fr |archive-date=28 July 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220728201802/https://www.ligue1.fr/Articles/ACTU/2022/05/21/kylian-mbappe-une-saison-historique |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name=":4">{{cite web |date=21 May 2022 |title=Meilleur buteur, meilleur passeur : Mbappé officiellement sacré ! |trans-title=Top scorer, top assist provider: Mbappé already crowned! |url=https://www.psg.fr/equipes/equipe-premiere/content/meilleur-buteur-meilleur-passeur-mbappe-officiellement-sacre |access-date=21 May 2022 |publisher=Paris Saint-Germain F.C. |language=fr |archive-date=30 July 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220730102242/https://www.psg.fr/equipes/equipe-premiere/content/meilleur-buteur-meilleur-passeur-mbappe-officiellement-sacre |url-status=live }}</ref>

==== 2022–24: All-time club goalscorer and final seasons ====
[[File:Messi Neymar Mbappé PSG 2022.jpg|thumb|right|Mbappé ''(right)'' celebrating a goal with PSG teammates Messi ''(left)'' and Neymar ''(middle)''|249x249px]]

On 13 August 2022, Mbappé scored his first goal of the season for [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|PSG]] in a 5–2 home victory over Montpellier, after having missed a penalty earlier in the match.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Zavala |first=Steve |date=13 August 2022 |title=Video: Mbappe Picks Up First Goal of the Ligue 1 Season in PSG's Fixture Against Montpellier |url=https://psgtalk.com/2022/08/video-mbappe-picks-up-first-goal-of-the-ligue-1-season-in-psg-fixture-against-montpellier/ |access-date=27 September 2022 |website=PSG Talk |archive-date=30 September 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220930172153/https://psgtalk.com/2022/08/video-mbappe-picks-up-first-goal-of-the-ligue-1-season-in-psg-fixture-against-montpellier/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Eight days later, he scored his first hat-trick of the season in a 7–1 away win over [[Lille OSC|Lille]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Grez |first=Matias |date=22 August 2022 |title=Kylian Mbappé scores a hat-trick – including 8-second goal from kick-off – as Paris Saint-Germain puts seven goals past Lille |url=https://www.cnn.com/2022/08/22/football/kylian-mbappe-hat-trick-psg-hammers-lille-spt-intl#:~:text=Kylian%20Mbapp%C3%A9%20scored%20a%20hat,should%20be%20on%20penalty%20duties. |access-date=27 September 2022 |publisher=CNN |archive-date=22 August 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220822110011/https://www.cnn.com/2022/08/22/football/kylian-mbappe-hat-trick-psg-hammers-lille-spt-intl#:~:text=Kylian%20Mbapp%C3%A9%20scored%20a%20hat,should%20be%20on%20penalty%20duties. |url-status=live }}</ref> His first goal in the match was clocked at eight seconds, making it the second-fastest goal ever scored in Ligue 1 history, tenths of seconds later than [[Michel Rio (footballer)|Michel Rio]]'s goal for Caen against [[AS Cannes|Cannes]] in 1992.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Molson |first=Johan |date=22 August 2022 |title=VIDÉO – Michel Rio, le Breton plus rapide que Kylian Mbappé |url=https://www.francebleu.fr/infos/insolite/video-michel-rio-le-breton-plus-rapide-que-kylian-mbappe-1661185886 |access-date=23 August 2022 |website=France Bleu |language=fr |archive-date=22 August 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220822163406/https://www.francebleu.fr/infos/insolite/video-michel-rio-le-breton-plus-rapide-que-kylian-mbappe-1661185886 |url-status=live }}</ref> On 6 September, Mbappé scored a brace in PSG's opening Champions League fixture against Juventus, securing a 2–1 home victory for the Parisians.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Booth |first=Chuck |date=6 September 2022 |title=PSG vs. Juventus score: Kylian Mbappe brace leads Paris Saint-Germain to Champions League victory |url=https://www.cbssports.com/soccer/news/psg-vs-juventus-score-kylian-mbappe-brace-leads-paris-saint-germain-to-champions-league-victory/live/ |access-date=27 September 2022 |website=CBS Sports |archive-date=30 September 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220930145723/https://www.cbssports.com/soccer/news/psg-vs-juventus-score-kylian-mbappe-brace-leads-paris-saint-germain-to-champions-league-victory/live/ |url-status=live }}</ref> On 11 October, he scored a penalty in a 1–1 Champions League draw at home to [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]], becoming the leading goalscorer for PSG in European competitions with 31 goals.<ref>{{Cite web |date=11 October 2022 |title=Mbappé is the club's top European goalscorer |url=https://en.psg.fr/teams/first-team/content/mbappe-is-the-clubs-top-european-goalscorer-sl-benfica-uefa-champions-league-2022-2023 |access-date=11 October 2022 |publisher=Paris Saint-Germain F.C. |archive-date=23 October 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221023184858/https://en.psg.fr/teams/first-team/content/mbappe-is-the-clubs-top-european-goalscorer-sl-benfica-uefa-champions-league-2022-2023 |url-status=live }}</ref> However, the match was played in the backdrop of media reports that Mbappé wanted to leave PSG in the January [[transfer window]], rumours which he denied, saying, "I'm very happy. I never asked for my departure in January."<ref>{{Cite web |date=20 October 2022 |title=What Does Kylian Mbappé Want? |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/robertkidd/2022/10/20/what-does-kylian-mbapp-want/?sh=1e32453917db |access-date=17 November 2022 |website=Forbes |archive-date=18 November 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221118015954/https://www.forbes.com/sites/robertkidd/2022/10/20/what-does-kylian-mbapp-want/?sh=1e32453917db |url-status=live }}</ref>

On 23 January 2023, Mbappé became the first PSG player to score five goals in a match, including a ten-minute hat-trick, in a 7–0 rout of [[US Pays de Cassel|Pays de Cassel]] in the Coupe de France round of 32.<ref>{{Cite web |date=23 January 2023 |title=What Does Kylian Mbappé Want? |url=https://www.foxsports.com/stories/soccer/kylian-mbappe-makes-psg-history-with-5-goal-match |access-date=24 January 2023 |website=Fox Sports |archive-date=5 February 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230205110912/https://www.foxsports.com/stories/soccer/kylian-mbappe-makes-psg-history-with-5-goal-match |url-status=live }}</ref> On 26 February, he scored two goals and assisted another as PSG defeated Marseille 3–0 in [[Le Classique]]. He thus became the club's joint all-time top goalscorer with 200 goals, equalizing Edinson Cavani's record.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Pretot |first1=Julien |last2=Davis |first2=Toby |date=26 February 2023 |title=PSG romp to 3–0 win over Marseille thanks to Mbappe-Messi double act |url=https://www.reuters.com/lifestyle/sports/psg-romp-3-0-win-over-marseille-thanks-mbappe-messi-double-act-2023-02-26/ |access-date=27 February 2023 |work=Reuters |archive-date=26 February 2023 the following match, a 4–2 win over Nantes, he scored his 201st goal for PSG, taking the throne as the club's leading scorer.<ref>{{Cite web |date=4 March 2023 |title=Mbappe breaks PSG's all-time scoring record |url=https://www.espn.com/soccer/paris-saint-germain--frapsg/story/4861911/kylian-mbappe-breaks-edinson-cavani-paris-saint-germain-all-time-scoring-record |access-date=4 March 2023 On 13 June 2023, via an official statement released through ''[[Agence France-Presse]]'', Mbappé announced his decision not to renew his contract with PSG, which was set to expire in June 2024; according to him, the club had been informed about his decision since 15 July 2022.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Butler |first=Michael |date=12 June 2023 |title=Kylian Mbappé stuns PSG with formal decision not to renew contract in 2024 |language=en-GB |work=The Guardian |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2023/jun/12/kylian-mbappe-stuns-psg-with-formal-decision-not-to-renew-contract-real-madrid |access-date=13 June 2023 |issn=0261-3077 |archive-date=12 June 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230612233330/https://www.theguardian.com/football/2023/jun/12/kylian-mbappe-stuns-psg-with-formal-decision-not-to-renew-contract-real-madrid |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Panja |first=Tariq |date=12 June 2023 |title=Kylian Mbappé Tells P.S.G. Mbappé eventually made his first appearance of the [[2023–24 Paris Saint-Germain F.C. season|2023–24 season]] in a 1–1 draw away to [[Toulouse FC|Toulouse]] on 19 August, scoring his team's only goal, PSG's first of the season.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Toulouse 1–1 Paris Saint-Germain (Aug 19, 2023) Game Analysis |url=https://www.espn.com/soccer/report/_/gameId/677220 |access-date=20 August 2023 August, he scored his 150th and 151st Ligue 1 goals for the club as PSG beat [[RC Lens|Lens]] 3–1 at home.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Mbappé scores twice on Parc des Princes return, Marseille struggles in French league |url=https://apnews.com/article/french-league-marseille-brest-psg-lens-32725fd28cfb88eed0dd71f98514de79 |date=26 August 2023 |access-date=26 August 2023 |publisher=[[Associated Press]]
