|url-status=live }}</ref> On 19 September, Mbappé scored PSG's first Champions League goal of the season in a 2–0 win over Borussia Dortmund.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://apnews.com/article/champions-league-psg-dortmund-65562b5012326f1ce6f273d2dc673f0c |title=Mbappé and Hakimi score as PSG wins 2-0 against Dortmund in Champions League |access-date=11 in a 3–0 win over AC Milan on matchday three of the competition on 25 October.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Paris Saint-Germain 3-0 AC Milan (Oct 25, 2023) Final Score |url=https://www.espn.com/soccer/match/_/gameId/687581 |access-date=2023-11-11 |website=ESPN |language=en |archive-date=11 November 2023 3–0 win over Reims, lifting PSG to the top of the Ligue 1 table.<ref>{{Cite news |date=2023-11-11 |title=Mbappe hat-trick lifts PSG to the top |language=en |work=Reuters |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2023/nov/28/mbappe-and-var-penalty-hurt-newcastle-at-the-last-to-rescue-psg-draw |title=Mbappé and VAR hurt Newcastle as stoppage-time penalty saves PSG which proved to be crucial for the club, as they qualified to the knockout stages, following a 1–1 away draw against Borussia Dortmund on 13 December.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2023/dec/13/borussia-dortmund-psg-champions-league-match-report |title=PSG edge through behind Dortmund as Zaïre-Emery hints at exciting future |work=The Guardian |date=13 December 2023 |access-date=23 December 2023 |archive-date=24 December 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231224014835/https://www.theguardian.com/football/2023/dec/13/borussia-dortmund-psg-champions-league-match-report |url-status=live }}</ref> 

On 3 January 2024, Mbappé scored the second goal in a 2–0 victory over Toulouse in the [[2023 Trophée des Champions]], securing his first trophy of the season. In the process, Mbappé became the all-time top goalscorer at the Parc des Princes, with his 111th goal surpassing Edinson Cavani's scoring record.<ref>{{Cite web |date=3 January 2024 |title=Lucas Beraldo makes Paris debut |url=https://en.psg.fr/teams/first-team/content/lucas-beraldo-makes-paris-debut-paris-saint-germain-toulouse-fc-trophee-des-champions-2023-2024 |access-date=3 January 2024 |publisher=[[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.]] |archive-date=3 January 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240103221810/https://en.psg.fr/teams/first-team/content/lucas-beraldo-makes-paris-debut-paris-saint-germain-toulouse-fc-trophee-des-champions-2023-2024 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=3 January 2024 |title=Kylian Mbappe is a history maker! PSG talisman sets new Parc des Princes record after goal in Trophee des Champions final against Toulouse |url=https://www.goal.com/en-gb/lists/kylian-mbappe-history-maker-psg-parc-des-princes-record-goal-trophee-des-champions-final-toulouse/bltfea402f0bb72ae45#csb3321c17114494a2 |access-date=8 January 2024 |publisher=[[Goal (website)|Goal]] |archive-date=8 January 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240108170531/https://www.goal.com/en-gb/lists/kylian-mbappe-history-maker-psg-parc-des-princes-record-goal-trophee-des-champions-final-toulouse/bltfea402f0bb72ae45#csb3321c17114494a2 |url-status=live }}</ref> On 7 January 2024, Mbappé scored his first hat-trick of the year in a 9–0 thrashing of [[US Revel|Revel]] in the round of 64 of the Coupe de France, becoming the club's all-time top scorer in the competition by bringing his goal tally to 30.<ref>{{Cite news |date=2024-01-07 |title=Revel 0-9 Paris Saint-Germain: Kylian Mbappe scores hat-trick in French Cup win |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/67908686#:~:text=Kylian%20Mbappe%20scored%20a%20hat,top%20scorer%20in%20the%20cup. |access-date=2024-01-08 |work=[[BBC Sport]] |archive-date=8 January 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240108120911/https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/67908686#:~:text=Kylian%20Mbappe%20scored%20a%20hat,top%20scorer%20in%20the%20cup. |url-status=live }}</ref> On 15 February, it was reported in the media that Mbappé had informed PSG that he intended to leave the club upon expiration of his contract in June 2024.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Mbappe tells PSG he intends to leave the club |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/68309952 |access-date=2024-02-15 |work=BBC Sport |language=en-GB |archive-date=15 February 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240215170150/https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/68309952 |url-status=live }}</ref> On 5 March, he scored a brace in a 2–1 win away to [[Real Sociedad]] in the round of 16 of the Champions League, securing PSG's qualification to the quarter-finals for the first time since the 2020–21 season.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Real Sociedad 1-2 Paris St-Germain |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/68482743 |access-date=5 March 2024 |date=5 March 2024 |website=[[BBC Sport]] |archive-date=5 March 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240305204959/https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/68482743 |url-status=live }}</ref> Mbappé scored his second hat-trick of the regular season and his first of the year on 19 March in a 6–2 win away at Montpellier, taking him to 250 goals in all competitions for PSG.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Jones |first=Rhys |date=2024-03-17 |title=MONTPELLIER 2-6 PARIS SAINT-GERMAIN: KYLIAN MBAPPE SCORES HAT-TRICK AS LUIS ENRIQUE'S SIDE CLOSE ON TITLE |url=https://www.eurosport.com/football/ligue-1/2023-2024/montpellier-2-6-paris-saint-germain-kylian-mbappe-scores-hat-trick-as-luis-enrique-s-side-close-on-t_sto10062706/story.shtml |access-date=2024-03-19 |website=[[Eurosport]] |archive-date=18 March 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240318013342/https://www.eurosport.com/football/ligue-1/2023-2024/montpellier-2-6-paris-saint-germain-kylian-mbappe-scores-hat-trick-as-luis-enrique-s-side-close-on-t_sto10062706/story.shtml |url-status=live }}</ref> On 16 April, he scored two goals in a 4–1 away win over Barcelona to help PSG qualify for the Champions League semi-finals after having lost the first leg 3–2 at the Parc des Princes.<ref>{{Cite web |last= |first= |title=Kylian Mbappe bags brace as PSG stun Barcelona to reach Champions League semis |url=https://www.beinsports.com/en-us/soccer/uefa-champions-league/articles/kylian-mbappe-bags-brace-as-psg-stun-barcelona-to-reach-champions-league-semis-2024-04-16 |access-date=2024-04-18 |website=beIN SPORTS |language=en-us |archive-date=4 May 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240504181315/https://www.beinsports.com/en-us/soccer/uefa-champions-league/articles/kylian-mbappe-bags-brace-as-psg-stun-barcelona-to-reach-champions-league-semis-2024-04-16 |url-status=live }}</ref> In the semi-finals, PSG was knocked out by Borussia Dortmund, after losing 2–0 on aggregate.<ref>{{cite web |last=Dominski |first=Michael |url=https://theathletic.com/live-blogs/psg-dortmund-live-updates-champions-league-score-result/noPrBVsoDvsb/ |title=PSG vs Dortmund live updates: Bundesliga side into Champions League final after 2-0 aggregate victory |publisher=The Athletic |date=7 May 2024 }}</ref>  

On 10 May 2024, Mbappé announced via his social media handles he would depart Paris Saint-Germain at the end of the season stating he would not renew his contract, marking the end of his career at the club.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Onyeagwara |first=Nnamdi |date=10 May 2024 |title=Kylian Mbappe confirms he will leave PSG at the end of this season |url=https://theathletic.com/5484933/2024/05/10/kylian-mbappe-psg-transfer-exit/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240510212734/https://theathletic.com/5484933/2024/05/10/kylian-mbappe-psg-transfer-exit/ |archive-date=10 May 2024 |access-date=10 May 2024 |publisher=The Athletic |language=en-GB}}</ref> On 12 May, he played his last match at the Parc de Princes as a PSG player, scoring a goal in a 3–1 loss to Toulouse.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Poole |first=Harry |date=12 May 2024 |title=Paris St-Germain 1–3 Toulouse: Kylian Mbappé scores in final home game but PSG beaten |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/live/cyj3kd2v7j9t |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240513120157/https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/live/cyj3kd2v7j9t |archive-date=13 May 2024 |access-date=13 May 2024 |publisher=BBC Sport |language=en-GB}}</ref> He played his final match for the club on 25 May, featuring in the entirety of PSG's [[2024 Coupe de France final|Coupe de France final]] victory over Lyon, securing his last title with the club.<ref>{{Cite web |date=25 May 2024 |title=PSG beat Lyon 2–1 to win French Cup final in Mbappe's farewell appearance |url=https://www.reuters.com/sports/soccer/psg-beat-lyon-2-1-french-cup-final-clinch-domestic-treble-2024-05-25/ |access-date=25 May 2024 |website=[[Reuters]]}}</ref>

==International career==
===2014–2018: Youth level and senior debut===
[[File:Kylian Mbappe celebrating - March 2018 (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Mbappé playing for [[France national football team|France]] in March 2018]]

In July 2016, Mbappé scored five times for [[France national under-19 football team|France]] as they won the [[2016 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]]. His second-half brace in the 3–1 victory over [[Portugal national under-19 football team|Portugal]] in the semi-finals had helped his team reach the final.<ref name=youthcareer/> He was included in [[2016 UEFA European Under-19 Championship#Team of the Tournament|the competition's Team of the Tournament]].<ref name=":5" />

Mbappé was called up to the senior [[France national football team|France]] squad for the first time to face [[Luxembourg national football team|Luxembourg]] and [[Spain national football team|Spain]] in March 2017.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/8/main/2017/03/16/33699112/monaco-star-mbappe-given-maiden-france-call-up?ICID=HP_BN_3 |title=Monaco star Mbappé given maiden France call-up |website=Goal |publisher=Perform Group |date=16 March 2017 |access-date=16 March 2017 |archive-date=17 March 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170317054814/http://www.goal.com/en/news/8/main/2017/03/16/33699112/monaco-star-mbappe-given-maiden-france-call-up?ICID=HP_BN_3 |url-status=live}}</ref> He made his debut on 25 March against the former side, coming on for [[Dimitri Payet]] in the 78th minute of a 3–1 [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2018 FIFA World Cup qualification]] away win.<ref name="soccerway"/> In doing so, he became the second youngest player ever (only behind [[Maryan Wisniewski]]) to feature for France, at 18 years, three months and five days of age.<ref>{{cite web |first=Kaveh |last=Solhekol |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/10927624/liverpool-interested-in-signing-monacos-kylian-mbappe |title=Liverpool interested in signing Monaco's Kylian Mbappe |date=26 June 2017 |website=Sky Sports |access-date=6 July 2017 |quote=Mbappe became the second youngest player to play for France [behind only Maryan Wisnieski] when he made his debut against Luxembourg in March, aged 18 years, three months and five days old. |archive-date=7 July 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170707131524/http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11669/10927624/liverpool-interested-in-signing-monacos-kylian-mbappe |url-status=live}}</ref> On 31 August 2017, Mbappé scored his first senior international goal in a 2018 World Cup qualification match against the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/round=276483/match=300331903/index.html |title=France v. Netherlands |date=31 August 2017 |publisher=FIFA |access-date=31 August 2017 |archive-date=13 December 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171213082001/https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/round=276483/match=300331903/index.html |url-status=dead}}</ref> He scored twice in a friendly against [[Russia national football team|Russia]] in March 2018.<ref>{{cite news |title=Russia 1–3 France |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43549170 |access-date=2 July 2018 |website=BBC Sport |date=27 March 2018 |archive-date=29 April 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180429193608/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43549170 |url-status=live}}</ref>

===2018–2021: FIFA World Cup triumph===
[[File:Kylian Mbappé World Cup Trophy.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Mbappé holding the World Cup trophy after France won the [[2018 FIFA World Cup final|2018 World Cup final]]]]

On 17 May 2018, Mbappé was called up to the [[2018 FIFA World Cup squads#France|France squad]] for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]] in Russia.<ref>[https://www.skysports.com/amp/football/news/12025/11376691/alexandre-lacazette-and-anthony-martial-on-standby-for-france-world-cup-squad-and-dimitri-payet-out "France name squad for 2018 World Cup"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180704123904/http://www.skysports.com/amp/football/news/12025/11376691/alexandre-lacazette-and-anthony-martial-on-standby-for-france-world-cup-squad-and-dimitri-payet-out |date=4 July 2018 }}. Sky Sports. Retrieved 30 June 2018</ref> On 21 June 2018, he scored his first World Cup goal in ''Les Bleus''<nowiki/>' 1–0 [[2018 FIFA World Cup Group C|group stage]] win over [[Peru national football team|Peru]]. This made him the youngest French goalscorer in World Cup history, aged 19.<ref>{{Cite web |title=World Cup: Kylian Mbappe becomes France's youngest goalscorer in a major tournament |url=https://www.cbssports.com/soccer/news/world-cup-kylian-mbappe-becomes-frances-youngest-goal-scorer-in-a-major-tournament/ |first1=Kevin |last1=Skiver |access-date=18 August 2023 |date=21 June 2018 |website=[[CBS Sports]] |archive-date=19 August 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230819010603/https://www.cbssports.com/soccer/news/world-cup-kylian-mbappe-becomes-frances-youngest-goal-scorer-in-a-major-tournament/ |url-status=live }}</ref> On 30 June 2018, he was named [[Player of the match|man of the match]] in a [[2018 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#France vs Argentina|4–3 win]] over [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]] in the round of 16, having won a penalty for his team and scored two goals.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/match/300331537 |title=France 4–3 Argentina |date=30 June 2018 |publisher=FIFA |access-date=30 June 2018 |archive-date=30 June 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180630132618/https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/match/300331537/ |url-status=dead}}</ref> Mbappé was the second teenager to score two goals in a World Cup match after [[Pelé]] in [[1958 FIFA World Cup|1958]].<ref>{{cite news |title=France 4–3 Argentina |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44439354 |website=BBC Sport |date=1 July 2018 |access-date=30 June 2018 |archive-date=3 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180703160605/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44439354 |url-status=live}}</ref> In a post-match press conference, he stated: "It's flattering to be the second one after Pelé but let's put things into context – Pelé is in another category."<ref name="Pelé 1958">{{cite news |title=Mbappe shakes off Pelé comparisons after stunning brace |url=https://www.rte.ie/sport/world-cup-2018/2018/0630/974415-mbappe-shakes-off-pele-comparisons-after-stunning-brace/ |website=RTÉ Sport |date=1 July 2018 |access-date=1 July 2018 |archive-date=1 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180701193806/https://www.rte.ie/sport/world-cup-2018/2018/0630/974415-mbappe-shakes-off-pele-comparisons-after-stunning-brace/ |url-status=live}}</ref> On 15 July, Mbappé scored with a 25-yard strike against [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]] in the [[2018 FIFA World Cup final|2018 World Cup final]], with France gaining a 4–2 win.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44754965 |title=France 4–2 Croatia |first=Phil |last=McNulty |website=BBC Sport |date=15 July 2018 |access-date=23 August 2020 |archive-date=25 March 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190325011256/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44754965 |url-status=live}}</ref> He became the second teenager, after Pelé, to [[List of FIFA World Cup final goalscorers|score in a World Cup final]]: moreover, having scored four goals in the tournament, he received the [[FIFA World Cup Best Young Player Award]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/157-awards-piece-2986294 |title=Golden consolation for magical Modric |date=15 July 2018 |publisher=FIFA |access-date=12 December 2020 |archive-date=19 February 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190219104856/https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/157-awards-piece-2986294 |url-status=live }}</ref> Pelé congratulated him on social media, saying quote, "welcome to the club".<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/world-cup-2018-france-croatia-pele-kylian-mbappe-welcome-to-the-club-teenage-scorer-goal-video-a8448611.html |title='Welcome to the club' – Pele praises Kylian Mbappe for becoming the second teenager to score in a World Cup final |newspaper=The Independent |last=Twomey |first=Liam |date=15 July 2019 |access-date=16 July 2018 |archive-date=16 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180716153330/https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/world-cup-2018-france-croatia-pele-kylian-mbappe-welcome-to-the-club-teenage-scorer-goal-video-a8448611.html |url-status=live}}</ref>

On 11 June 2019, Mbappé scored his 100th career goal in a 4–0 away win over [[Andorra national football team|Andorra]] in [[UEFA Euro 2020 qualifying|Euro 2020 qualifying]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.beinsports.com/us/euro-2020-qualifiers/news/mbappe-scores-100th-career-goal/1215634 |title=Mbappe Scores 100th Career Goal |publisher=beIN Sports |date=11 June 2019 |access-date=10 November 2019 |archive-date=10 November 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191110212048/https://www.beinsports.com/us/euro-2020-qualifiers/news/mbappe-scores-100th-career-goal/1215634 |url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.tuttosport.com/news/calcio/calcio-estero/2019/06/12-57904455/mbappe_nella_storia_contro_andorra_gol_numero_100_in_carriera/ |title=Mbappé nella storia: contro Andorra gol numero 100 in carriera |trans-title=Mbappé makes history: against Andorra his 100th career goal |website=TuttoSport |language=it |date=12 June 2019 |access-date=16 May 2020 |archive-date=3 August 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200803022503/https://www.tuttosport.com/news/calcio/calcio-estero/2019/06/12-57904455/mbappe_nella_storia_contro_andorra_gol_numero_100_in_carriera/ |url-status=live}}</ref> On 5 September 2020, Mbappé scored the only goal for France in a 1–0 [[UEFA Nations League]] win against [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]]. However, two days after the game, he tested positive for [[Coronavirus disease 2019|COVID-19]].<ref name=":2" /> He returned to play for France in a 7–1 victory against [[Ukraine national football team|Ukraine]] on 7 October 2020, scoring a goal.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Giroud up to second on France goals list |website=BBC Sport |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/54366305 |access-date=29 October 2020 |archive-date=11 October 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201011205413/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/54366305 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=7 October 2020 |title=Giroud scores twice as France beats Ukraine 7–1 in friendly |url=https://apnews.com/article/ukraine-international-soccer-eduardo-camavinga-france-archive-a8af526e6bd28aeb7b46c574d9384f8a |access-date=19 August 2023 |website=AP News |language=en |archive-date=19 August 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230819023807/https://apnews.com/article/ukraine-international-soccer-eduardo-camavinga-france-archive-a8af526e6bd28aeb7b46c574d9384f8a |url-status=live }}</ref> One week later, he scored the match-winning goal in a 2–1 win against Croatia.<ref>{{cite web |title=Croatia vs. France – Football Match Report – October 14, 2020 – ESPN |url=https://www.espn.com/soccer/report?gameId=570699 |access-date=29 October 2020 |publisher=ESPN |archive-date=29 May 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210529025408/https://www.espn.com/soccer/report?gameId=570699 |url-status=live }}</ref> France topped their Nations League Group and qualified for the [[2021 UEFA Nations League Finals]].<ref>{{cite web |title=UEFA Nations League – Standings |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefanationsleague/standings/ |access-date=20 May 2021 |publisher=UEFA |archive-date=10 June 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210610173844/https://www.uefa.com/uefanationsleague/standings/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

[[UEFA Euro 2020]] was postponed for a year because of the [[COVID-19 pandemic]].<ref>{{cite news |date=17 March 2020 |title=Football: Uefa confirms Euro 2020 postponed for a year because of coronavirus crisis |url=https://www.straitstimes.com/sport/football/football-euro-2020-postponed-for-a-year-by-uefa-because-of-coronavirus-crisis-says |access-date=5 July 2021 |work=The Straits Times |location=Singapore |agency=Reuters |archive-date=1 May 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210501030742/https://www.straitstimes.com/sport/football/football-euro-2020-postponed-for-a-year-by-uefa-because-of-coronavirus-crisis-says |url-status=live }}</ref> On 18 May 2021, Mbappé was included in the [[UEFA Euro 2020 squads#France|France squad for UEFA Euro 2020]], his second major international tournament.<ref>{{cite news |title=Karim Benzema named in France squad for first time in six years |date=18 May 2021 |url=https://theathletic.com/news/benzema-france-euro-2020-squad/ILy40oON8OQr |access-date=20 May 2021 |website=The Athletic |archive-date=20 May 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210520061200/https://theathletic.com/news/benzema-france-euro-2020-squad/ILy40oON8OQr |url-status=live }}</ref> On 15 June, he scored a goal and assisted another one, both of which were later deemed to be [[Offside (association football)|offside]], in a [[UEFA Euro 2020 Group F|group stage]] match against [[Germany national football team|Germany]]. On 28 June, he provided the assist for Karim Benzema's first goal in France's match against [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]] in the [[UEFA Euro 2020 knockout phase#Round of 16|round of 16]]. After a 3–3 draw, the game went to a [[penalty shoot-out]]; Mbappé failed to score the decisive fifth penalty, and France were eliminated from the tournament.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Switzerland beat France on penalties |website=BBC Sport |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/51198549 |date=28 June 2021 |access-date=28 June 2021 |archive-date=3 July 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210703195124/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/51198549 |url-status=live }}</ref> The forward failed to score in any of the four games France played in the competition.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/57647313 |title=Kylian Mbappe and world champions France's fall from top |website=BBC Sport |date=28 June 2021 |access-date=28 June 2021 |archive-date=1 July 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210701022312/https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/57647313 |url-status=live }}</ref>

===2021–2023: Nations League title and second consecutive World Cup final===
[[File:Mbappé 25032021.jpg|thumb|right|Mbappé playing for France in a [[2022 FIFA World Cup qualification|2022 FIFA World Cup qualifying game]] against [[Ukraine national football team|Ukraine]] in Paris played behind closed doors, March 2021]]

In the Nations League semi-final on 7 October 2021, Mbappé assisted Benzema and later scored a goal himself from the penalty spot to help France come from behind and defeat [[Belgium national football team|Belgium]] 3–2. In the process, he made his 50th appearance for ''Les Bleus'' at 22 years and nine-and-a-half months.<ref>{{cite news |date=7 October 2021 |title=Theo Hernandez caps France's fightback to stun Belgium in semi-final thriller |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2021/oct/07/belgium-france-nations-league-semi-final-match-report |access-date=10 October 2021 |archive-date=29 November 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221129004936/https://www.theguardian.com/football/2021/oct/07/belgium-france-nations-league-semi-final-match-report |url-status=live }}</ref> Three days later, in the [[2021 UEFA Nations League final|final]] against Spain, he once again set-up Benzema to tie the match, and later scored the 2–1 winning goal for France to clinch their first title.<ref>{{cite web |date=10 October 2021 |title=Spain vs. France – Football Match Report |url=https://www.espn.co.uk/football/report?gameId=589985 |access-date=10 October 2021 |publisher=ESPN |archive-date=5 November 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221105003859/https://www.espn.co.uk/football/report?gameId=589985 |url-status=live }}</ref> With two goals and two assists in the Nations League Finals, Mbappé was awarded the competition's Golden Boot, known as the "[[Alipay]] Top Scorer Trophy."<ref name="2021 Nations League Top Scorer">{{cite news |date=10 October 2021 |title=UEFA Nations League finals top scorer: Kylian Mbappé |publisher=UEFA |url=https://www.uefa.com/uefanationsleague/news/026e-137297f2e715-0d7aed764ef3-1000/ |access-date=10 October 2021 |archive-date=17 November 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221117163245/https://www.uefa.com/uefanationsleague/news/026e-137297f2e715-0d7aed764ef3-1000/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

On 13 November, Mbappé scored his first goals in the [[2022 FIFA World Cup qualification|2022 World Cup qualifiers]] by finding the net four times in an 8–0 win over [[Kazakhstan national football team|Kazakhstan]], as France booked their place for the tournament's finals.<ref>{{cite web |date=13 November 2021 |title=France 8–0 Kazakhstan: Kylian Mbappe scores four times for world champions to book Qatar place |url=https://www.eurosport.com/football/world-cup-qualification-uefa/2022/world-cup-qualifying-live-france-v-kazakhstan_sto8621561/story.shtml |access-date=20 November 2021 |website=Eurosport |archive-date=27 October 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231027132138/https://www.eurosport.com/geoblocking.shtml |url-status=live }}</ref> His super hat-trick, which included a 32-minute first half hat-trick, was his first one in an international match, as well as the first competitive hat-trick scored for France since [[Dominique Rocheteau]] in 1985.<ref>{{cite web |date=13 November 2021 |title=Kylian Mbappe nets blistering first-half hat-trick for France against Kazakhstan |url=https://www.givemesport.com/1785015-kylian-mbappe-scores-firsthalf-hattrick-for-france-in-world-cup-qualifier-vs-kazakhstan |access-date=20 November 2021 |website=GiveMeSport |archive-date=29 July 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220729010055/https://www.givemesport.com/1785015-kylian-mbappe-scores-firsthalf-hattrick-for-france-in-world-cup-qualifier-vs-kazakhstan |url-status=live }}</ref> Three days later, Mbappé scored and served his fifth assist for Benzema in a row in a 2–0 away win over [[Finland national football team|Finland]] in the last World Cup qualifier.<ref>{{Cite news |title=France win denies Finland play-off spot |website=BBC Sport |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/59234086 |access-date=20 November 2021 |archive-date=21 November 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221121125030/https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/59234086 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |date=17 November 2021 |title=Equipe de France : Benzema-Mbappé, un duo sans égal dans l'histoire des Bleus ? |url=https://www.leparisien.fr/sports/football/equipe-de-france-benzema-mbappe-un-duo-sans-egal-dans-lhistoire-des-bleus-17-11-2021-RBHNL5MWYBFJDNG7UNKYO5K4CM.php |access-date=20 November 2021 |website=Le Parisien |language=fr |archive-date=28 July 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220728233416/https://www.leparisien.fr/sports/football/equipe-de-france-benzema-mbappe-un-duo-sans-egal-dans-lhistoire-des-bleus-17-11-2021-RBHNL5MWYBFJDNG7UNKYO5K4CM.php |url-status=live }}</ref>

[[File:2022 FIFA World Cup France 4–1 Australia - (8).jpg|thumb|left|upright|225x225px|Mbappé in a [[2022 FIFA World Cup]] [[2022 FIFA World Cup Group D|group stage match]] against [[Australia men's national soccer team|Australia]], November 2022]]

France kicked off their [[2022 FIFA World Cup]] campaign in Qatar against [[Australia men's national soccer team|Australia]] on 22 November 2022. In the match, Mbappé was involved in three of France's goals in a 4–1 victory; he was in the build-up for the second goal, scored the third – a header from an [[Ousmane Dembélé]] cross, and assisted [[Olivier Giroud]] for the fourth goal.<ref>{{Cite web |date=22 November 2022 |title=How Mbappe 'terrorised' Aussies – and the stat that shows just how 'stupidly good' he really was |url=https://www.foxsports.com.au/football/world-cup/just-unplayable-insane-stat-highlights-mbappes-dominance-in-stupidly-good-performance/news-story/40ec77ac4f134dc3f34d6818882fe07e |access-date=28 November 2022 |website=Fox Sports |archive-date=15 December 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221215235248/https://www.foxsports.com.au/football/world-cup/just-unplayable-insane-stat-highlights-mbappes-dominance-in-stupidly-good-performance/news-story/40ec77ac4f134dc3f34d6818882fe07e |url-status=live }}</ref> Four days later, Mbappé scored both of France's goals in a 2–1 victory over [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]], securing qualification to the knockout stages and thus breaking the "[[Sports-related curses#European World Cup champions' curse|World Cup Champions' Curse]]".<ref>{{Cite web |last=Tagoe |first=Godwin Nii Armah |date=26 November 2022 |title=France break World Cup champion's curse in style after Denmark win |url=https://sportsbrief.com/football/28838-qatar-2022-france-nonsense-champion-curse-team-reach-16/ |access-date=28 November 2022 |website=SportsBrief |archive-date=25 May 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230525122832/https://sportsbrief.com/football/28838-qatar-2022-france-nonsense-champion-curse-team-reach-16/ |url-status=live }}</ref> In the knockout round of sixteen against [[Poland national football team|Poland]], Mbappé scored two more goals, the first into the roof of the net from 16 yards and the second being a curling strike into the top corner, in a 3–1 win.<ref>{{cite news |title=Giroud and Mbappé fire France into quarter-finals |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/63771032 |access-date=4 December 2022 |website=BBC Sport |archive-date=3 January 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230103080251/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/63771032 |url-status=live }}</ref>

After featuring in France's wins against [[England national football team|England]] and [[Morocco national football team|Morocco]], respectively, in the quarter and semi-finals, Mbappé became only the second player in history to score a hat-trick in a World Cup final, scoring three goals against Argentina in the [[2022 FIFA World Cup final|2022 World Cup final]].<ref>{{cite news |title=France's Mbappé Scores Hat Trick |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/siladityaray/2022/12/18/world-cup-final-live-frances-mbapp-scores-hat-trick-to-tie-argentina-3-3-in-extra-time/?sh=ec1eba939dbe#:~:text=France%27s%20Kylian%20Mbappé%20scored%20a,for%20supremacy%20on%20the%20field |access-date=18 December 2022 |website=Forbes |archive-date=21 February 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230221072403/https://www.forbes.com/sites/siladityaray/2022/12/18/world-cup-final-live-argentina-and-lionel-messi-beats-france-in-penalty-kicks-after-thrilling-game/#:~:text=France%27s%20Kylian%20Mbappé%20scored%20a,for%20supremacy%20on%20the%20field |url-status=live }}</ref> The ''Albiceleste'' had a 2–0 lead with just over ten minutes remaining, before the Frenchman scored twice in two minutes, the second being a volley after playing a [[Push and run|one-two]] with [[Marcus Thuram]]. In [[Overtime (sports)|extra time]], Argentina would take the lead again, thanks to Mbappé's PSG teammate Messi, before the forward scored a penalty to make it 3–3, at just four minutes from the end of extra time. The match went to a [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shoot-out]]; Mbappé scored his penalty, but France lost following misses by [[Kingsley Coman]] and [[Aurélien Tchouaméni]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Argentina beat France on penalties to win World Cup after stunning final|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2022/dec/18/world-cup-final-argentina-france-match-report|date=18 December 2022|access-date=18 December 2022|website=The Guardian|last=Hytner|first=David|archive-date=28 March 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230328074407/https://www.theguardian.com/football/2022/dec/18/world-cup-final-argentina-france-match-report|url-status=live}}</ref> Mbappé secured the tournament's [[FIFA World Cup Golden Boot|Golden Boot]] with eight goals, and became the sixth all-time top goalscorer in World Cup history with twelve goals, tied with Pelé.<ref>{{Cite web |last1=Summerscales |first1=Robert |title=Lionel Messi And Kylian Mbappe Shoot Up The List Of All-Time Top World Cup Goalscorers |url=https://www.si.com/fannation/soccer/futbol/news/all-time-top-world-cup-goalscorers-kylian-mbappe-up-to-6th |access-date=19 December 2022 |date=18 December 2022 |website=Si.com |archive-date=27 December 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221227045102/https://www.si.com/fannation/soccer/futbol/news/all-time-top-world-cup-goalscorers-kylian-mbappe-up-to-6th |url-status=live }}</ref> Having scored a goal in the 2018 final, Mbappé also became the outright top goalscorer in World Cup finals, with four goals, and his hat-trick was the first in a men's final since [[Geoff Hurst]] for England in [[1966 FIFA World Cup final|1966]].<ref>{{Cite web |title=Kylian Mbappe scores final hat-trick to join Sir Geoff Hurst in exclusive club |date=18 December 2022 |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/kylian-mbappe-scores-final-hat-190438340.html#:~:text=Kylian%20Mbappe%20became%20only%20the,looks%20at%20the%20two%20trebles. |access-date=19 December 2022 |website=[[Yahoo! Sports]] |archive-date=20 December 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221220053122/https://sports.yahoo.com/kylian-mbappe-scores-final-hat-190438340.html#:~:text=Kylian%20Mbappe%20became%20only%20the,looks%20at%20the%20two%20trebles. |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Smale |first=Simon |date=18 December 2022 |title=Kylian Mbappé nets World Cup final hat trick to prove his class, but there has to be a winner and a loser |url=https://www.abc.net.au/news/2022-12-19/kylian-mbappe-fifa-world-cup-final-hattrick-messi/101787976 |access-date=19 December 2022 |website=Abc.net |archive-date=18 February 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230218052637/https://www.abc.net.au/news/2022-12-19/kylian-mbappe-fifa-world-cup-final-hattrick-messi/101787976 |url-status=live }}</ref>

===2023–present: Captaincy and Euro qualification===
On 21 March 2023, following the international retirement of [[Hugo Lloris]], manager [[Didier Deschamps]] named Mbappé the new [[Captain (association football)|captain]] of France ahead of their [[UEFA Euro 2024 qualifying]] campaign.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Didier-deschamps-a-choisi-kylian-mbappe-comme-nouveau-capitaine-des-bleus/1387136|title=Didier Deschamps has chosen Kylian Mbappé as the new captain of the Blues|language=fr|date=21 March 2023|access-date=21 March 2023|work=L'Équipe|archive-date=20 March 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230320235018/https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Didier-deschamps-a-choisi-kylian-mbappe-comme-nouveau-capitaine-des-bleus/1387136|url-status=live}}</ref> Three days later, in his first match as captain, he led France to a 4–0 victory over the Netherlands, by assisting [[Antoine Griezmann]]'s goal and scoring a brace.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/65071952|title=EUROPEAN CHAMPIONSHIP QUALIFYING – GROUP B|language=en|date=24 March 2023|access-date=27 March 2023|work=[[BBC]]|archive-date=27 March 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230327150803/https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/65071952|url-status=live}}</ref> On 19 June, Mbappé scored a penalty in a 1–0 win over [[Greece national football team|Greece]], his 40th goal for ''Les Bleus''. On the same night, he also became the youngest player to make 70 appearances for France.<ref>{{Cite web |date=19 June 2023 |title=Equipe de France : 40e but pour Kylian Mbappé, à une longueur de Michel Platini |url=https://www.lefigaro.fr/sports/football/equipe-de-france/equipe-de-france-40e-but-pour-kylian-mbappe-a-une-longueur-de-michel-platini-20230619 |access-date=21 August 2023 |website=LEFIGARO |language=fr |archive-date=21 August 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230821054733/https://www.lefigaro.fr/sports/football/equipe-de-france/equipe-de-france-40e-but-pour-kylian-mbappe-a-une-longueur-de-michel-platini-20230619 |url-status=live }}</ref> On 13 October, Mbappé scored two goals for France in a 2–1 win over the Netherlands, securing qualification to [[UEFA Euro 2024]]. He also surpassed [[Michel Platini]] to become France's fourth all-time top scorer.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-10-13 |title=Kylian Mbappé scores 2 as France beats Netherlands 2-1 to qualify for European Championship |url=https://apnews.com/article/netherlands-france-mbappe-euro2024-06e4b9cea7a6568d108996a12ac039b2 |access-date=2023-10-14 |website=AP News |language=en |archive-date=13 October 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231013221227/https://apnews.com/article/netherlands-france-mbappe-euro2024-06e4b9cea7a6568d108996a12ac039b2 |url-status=live }}</ref> On 18 November, Mbappé scored a hat-trick and provided three assists in a 14–0 victory over [[Gibraltar national football team|Gibraltar]], France's largest-ever victory.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-11-18 |title=France's historic 14-0 thrashing of Gibraltar in numbers as Kylian Mbappe, Les Bleus shatter records |url=https://www.cbssports.com/soccer/news/frances-historic-14-0-thrashing-of-gibraltar-in-numbers-as-kylian-mbappe-les-bleus-shatter-records/ |access-date=2023-11-19 |website=CBSSports.com |language=en |archive-date=19 November 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231119181801/https://www.cbssports.com/soccer/news/frances-historic-14-0-thrashing-of-gibraltar-in-numbers-as-kylian-mbappe-les-bleus-shatter-records/ |url-status=live }}</ref> His third goal of the match, a long-range shot from "40 metres out", was his 300th career goal.<ref>{{Cite news |date=2023-11-19 |title=Mbappe scores 300th goal but focuses on France's record win |language=en |work=Reuters |url=https://www.reuters.com/sports/soccer/mbappe-scores-300th-goal-focuses-frances-record-win-2023-11-19/ |access-date=2023-11-19 |archive-date=19 November 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231119181804/https://www.reuters.com/sports/soccer/mbappe-scores-300th-goal-focuses-frances-record-win-2023-11-19/ |url-status=live }}</ref> He also surpassed Griezmann as France's third all-time top scorer, reaching 46 goals.<ref>{{Cite web |last= |first= |date=18 November 2023 |title=France-Gibraltar : un triplé, 46 buts en Bleu, 300 buts en carrière, l'incroyable soirée de Mbappé |url=https://www.leparisien.fr/sports/football/equipe-de-france/france-gibraltar-un-triple-46-buts-en-bleu-300-buts-en-carriere-lincroyable-soiree-de-mbappe-18-11-2023-DAPSBUMJJJDZBCETVVKW74YIEQ.php |access-date=19 November 2023 |website=[[Le Parisien]] |language=fr-FR |archive-date=18 November 2023 ==Player profile==
===Style of play===
[[File:Kylian Mbappe 2017.jpg|thumb|Mbappé's explosive movement is often highlighted as one of his most important assets |292x292px]]

During the beginning of his career, Mbappé was compared to various greats in the history of football. He was described by [[Arsène Wenger]] as a "huge football talent" who "has similar qualities" to Thierry Henry.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Why Monaco starlet Kylian Mbappe is similar to Thierry Henry |url=https://www.espn.com/soccer/story/_/id/37466860/why-monaco-starlet-kylian-mbappe-similar-thierry-henry |access-date=18 August 2023 |date=3 February 2017 |first1=Ian |last1=Holyman |website=[[ESPN]] |language=en |archive-date=19 August 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230819010148/https://www.espn.com/soccer/story/_/id/37466860/why-monaco-starlet-kylian-mbappe-similar-thierry-henry |url-status=live }}</ref> His talent and stand-out performances for France at the 2018 World Cup also led him to be compared to Pelé in the media.<ref>{{cite news |last=Leicester |first=John |date=24 June 2018 |title=France's Kylian Mbappe emerges as star in World Cup spotlight |newspaper=Toronto Star |url=https://www.thestar.com/sports/worldcup/2018/06/24/frances-kylian-mbappe-emerges-as-star-in-world-cup-spotlight.html |url-status=live |access-date=11 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180712020617/https://www.thestar.com/sports/worldcup/2018/06/24/frances-kylian-mbappe-emerges-as-star-in-world-cup-spotlight.html |archive-date=12 July 2018}}</ref> Former France international [[Nicolas Anelka]] said that Mbappé's ability to run at defences reminded him of [[Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)|Ronaldo]]'s performances at the [[Football at the 1996 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|1996 Olympics]], and that Mbappé had the characteristics of a "world-class player".<ref>{{Cite web |date=2023-08-30 |title=Anelka tells Real Madrid target Mbappe: Be like Ronaldo, not me - Tribal Football |url=http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/anelka-tells-real-madrid-target-mbappe-be-like-ronaldo-not-me-4178742 |access-date=2023-08-31 |website=www.tribalfootball.com |archive-date=30 June 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180630185758/http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/anelka-tells-real-madrid-target-mbappe-be-like-ronaldo-not-me-4178742 |url-status=live }}</ref>

===Reception===
Often regarded as the best player in the world since the decline of the [[Messi–Ronaldo rivalry|Messi–Ronaldo]] dominance, Mbappé is generally viewed as one of the best players of his generation, if not the best.<ref>{{Cite web |date=5 December 2022 |title=Is Mbappe the undisputed best of this generation? |url=https://spogonews.com/does-anyone-in-this-generation-come-close-to-mbappe/ |access-date=24 July 2023 |language=en-US |archive-date=24 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230724125533/https://spogonews.com/does-anyone-in-this-generation-come-close-to-mbappe/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=23 July 2018 |title=KYLIAN MBAPPE: THE FUTURE OF FOOTBALL IS MORE THAN THE FUTURE |url=https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2787035-kylian-mbappe-france-world-football-power-50 |website=[[Bleacher Report]] |access-date=24 July 2023 |archive-date=24 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230724125530/https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2787035-kylian-mbappe-france-world-football-power-50 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Jadon Sancho: Is the Borussia Dortmund teenager one of the best players in the world? |url=https://www.bundesliga.com/en/bundesliga/news/is-jadon-sancho-one-of-the-best-players-in-the-world-messi-ronaldo-mbappe-9752 |access-date=24 July 2023 |website=bundesliga.com – the official Bundesliga website |language=en |archive-date=24 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230724125532/https://www.bundesliga.com/en/bundesliga/news/is-jadon-sancho-one-of-the-best-players-in-the-world-messi-ronaldo-mbappe-9752 |url-status=live }}</ref> His individual and collective achievements, as well as his precocious development, has drawn much appraisal. Former French international [[Rio Mavuba]] remarked that if Mbappé had won the 2022 World Cup "he’d probably be the best French player (ever)", further saying "I love [Zinedine] Zidane but imagine, 23 years old, two World Cups, he’d be the best.”<ref>{{Cite web |date=19 December 2022 |title=Why the 'unstoppable' Kylian Mbappé now wears the crown as world's best player |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2022/12/18/football/kylian-mbappe-best-player-qatar-2022-messi-spt-intl/index.html |website=[[CNN]] |access-date=24 July 2023 |archive-date=4 June 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230604084938/https://edition.cnn.com/2022/12/18/football/kylian-mbappe-best-player-qatar-2022-messi-spt-intl/index.html |url-status=live }}</ref> During that same World Cup, [[Fox Sports]] deemed Mbappé as already one of the "World Cup's all-time greats" and "the best player in the world".<ref>{{Cite web |title=Kylian Mbappé is already one of the World Cup's all-time greats |url=https://www.foxsports.com/stories/soccer/kylian-mbappe-is-already-one-of-the-world-cups-all-time-greats |access-date=24 July 2023 |website=FOX Sports |language=en-US |archive-date=24 July 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230724131032/https://www.foxsports.com/stories/soccer/kylian-mbappe-is-already-one-of-the-world-cups-all-time-greats |url-status=live }}</ref>

Mbappé was named the fastest player in the world in a ranking by French newspaper ''[[Le Figaro]]''.<ref>{{cite news |title=Kylian Mbappé the fastest player in the world? |website=Ligue 1 |url= https://www.ligue1.com/Articles/NEWS/2020/04/18/kylian-mbappe-the-fastest-player-in-the-world |publisher=Ligue de Football Professionnel |access-date=5 August 2020 |date=18 April 2020 |archive-date=3 ==Personal life==
Mbappé is a practising Christian.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.sportsmanor.com/soccer-news-kylian-mbappe-religion-what-religion-does-the-worlds-second-most-expensive-soccer-player-follow/ |title=Kylian Mbappe's Religion: What Religion Does the World's Second-Most Expensive Soccer Player Follow? |first=Aliasgar |last=Ayaz |website=Sportsmanor |date=14 December 2022 |access-date=18 December 2022 |archive-date=24 January 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230124230736/https://www.sportsmanor.com/soccer-news-kylian-mbappe-religion-what-religion-does-the-worlds-second-most-expensive-soccer-player-follow/ |url-status=live }}</ref> In a 2018 interview with ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'', he spoke about the sacrifices he made as a teenager to focus on his football development: "I did not have the moments of so-called normal people during adolescence, like going out with friends, enjoying good times." But despite missing out on a "normal" life, Mbappé states he is "living the life he always dreamed of".<ref name="Time">{{cite news |title=Kylian Mbappe: France striker features on Time magazine front cover |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45834258 |access-date=12 October 2018 |website=BBC Sport |archive-date=13 October 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181013132136/https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45834258 |url-status=live}}</ref>

Just over four years after making his professional debut, he had over 50 million followers on [[Instagram]].<ref name="Time" /> As of 2023, he has [[List of most-followed Instagram accounts|over 100 million followers on Instagram]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Kylian Mbappé becomes most-followed French personality on Instagram |url=https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2023/kylian-mbappe-becomes-most-followed-french-personality-on-instagram/ |access-date=22 April 2023 |website=Get Football News France |archive-date=22 April 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230422113644/https://www.getfootballnewsfrance.com/2023/kylian-mbappe-becomes-most-followed-french-personality-on-instagram/ |url-status=live }}</ref> While he admits his "life has been totally turned upside down" since he first entered the spotlight, he says he is "happy".<ref name="Time" /> He is fluent in French, English, and Spanish.<ref>{{Cite web |date=13 August 2023 |title=How many languages does Kylian Mbappe speak? |url=https://onefootball.com/en/news/how-many-languages-does-kylian-mbappe-speak-35107525 |access-date=13 August 2023 |website=OneFootball |language=en |archive-date=13 August 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230813225708/https://onefootball.com/en/news/how-many-languages-does-kylian-mbappe-speak-35107525 |url-status=live }}</ref>

==Outside football==
===Media and sponsorship===
Mbappé has a sponsorship deal with sportswear and equipment supplier [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]]. In 2017, aged 18, he partnered with the brand to launch his own football boots, the Kylian Mbappé Nike Hypervenom 3.<ref>{{cite news |title=Nike Just Gave AS Monaco Sensation Kylian Mbappé His First Pair of Personalised Boots |url=https://www.complex.com/sports/2017/05/nike-kylian-mbappe |agency=Complex |date=29 June 2018 |access-date=30 June 2018 |archive-date=30 June 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180630025233/https://www.complex.com/sports/2017/05/nike-kylian-mbappe |url-status=live}}</ref> In 2018, he unveiled the Nike Mercurial Superfly VI boots, which were inspired by the R9 Mercurial boots of former Brazilian striker Ronaldo.<ref>{{cite news |title=Kylian Mbappé Just Leaked an Amazing New R9-Inspired Nike Mercurial Superfly VI |url=https://versus.uk.com/2018/04/kylian-mbappe-just-leaked-amazing-new-r9-inspired-nike-mercurial-superfly-vi/ |agency=Versus |date=29 June 2018 |access-date=30 June 2018 |archive-date=29 July 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180729011315/https://versus.uk.com/2018/04/kylian-mbappe-just-leaked-amazing-new-r9-inspired-nike-mercurial-superfly-vi/ |url-status=live}}</ref> In 2018, Swiss watchmaker [[Hublot]] signed Mbappé as a global ambassador.<ref>{{cite web |title=Kylian Mbappe |url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/kylian-mbappe/ |website=Forbes |access-date=21 May 2020 |archive-date=7 June 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200607204224/https://www.forbes.com/profile/kylian-mbappe/ |url-status=live}}</ref>

Mbappé has featured in [[EA Sports]]' [[FIFA (video game series)|''FIFA'' video game series]]: on ''[[FIFA 18]]'', he had the highest potential rating of 94.<ref>[https://www.fifaindex.com/player/231747/kylian-mbappé/ "Kylian Mbappe index"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180630161533/https://www.fifaindex.com/player/231747/kylian-mbapp%C3%A9/ |date=30 June 2018 }}. ===Philanthropy===
[[File:Kylian Mbappé receives the best young player award at the 2018 Football World Cup Russia.jpg|thumb|right|Mbappé (pictured receiving his FIFA World Cup young player award next to [[Russian President]] [[Vladimir Putin]] and [[French President]] [[Emmanuel Macron]]) met with the French president in February 2018 to discuss a sports project in Africa.]]

On 22 February 2018, Mbappé was joined by former African strikers [[George Weah]] and [[Didier Drogba]] in a meeting with French President [[Emmanuel Macron]] and [[FIFA]] president [[Gianni Infantino]] at the [[Élysée Palace]] in Paris, which focused on a sports development project in Africa.<ref>{{Cite news |year=2018 |title=Macron reçoit Weah à l'Elysée en présence de Drogba et Mbappé |language=fr |trans-title=Macron hosts Weah at the Elysée in the presence of Drogba and Mbappé |website=Paris Match |url=http://amp.parismatch.com/Actu/Politique/Macron-recoit-Weah-a-l-Elysee-en-presence-de-Drogba-et-Mbappe-1465295|url-status=live|access-date=21 February 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200605030601/https://amp.parismatch.com/Actu/Politique/Macron-recoit-Weah-a-l-Elysee-en-presence-de-Drogba-et-Mbappe-1465295|archive-date=5 June 2020}}</ref> Mbappé stated that the development of African sport is important to him due to his parents' African origins.<ref>{{cite news |title=Emmanuel Macron hosts meeting with Weah, Drogba and Mbappé |url=https://en.as.com/en/2018/02/23/football/1519342446_437752.html |access-date=23 August 2018 |newspaper=Diario AS |archive-date=24 August 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180824002310/https://en.as.com/en/2018/02/23/football/1519342446_437752.html |url-status=live}}</ref>

On 28 January 2019, Mbappé donated $34,000 (around £26,000) to a crowdfunding campaign to finance a private search mission to find football player [[Emiliano Sala]], whose light aircraft had [[2019 Piper PA-46 Malibu crash|gone missing]] over the [[English Channel]] a week earlier.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2019/01/28/football/emiliano-sala-crowd-funding-rescue-mission-spt-intl/index.html |title=Emiliano Sala: Kylian Mbappe donates $34,000 to crowdfunding initiative |publisher=CNN |date=28 January 2019 |access-date=10 February 2019 |archive-date=3 August 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200803014857/https://edition.cnn.com/2019/01/28/football/emiliano-sala-crowd-funding-rescue-mission-spt-intl/index.html |url-status=live}}</ref> Later, on 10 February 2019, Mbappé donated a further £27,000 to the GoFundMe campaign created to fund the search for the plane's still-missing pilot, David Ibbotson.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/kylian-mbappe-donation-search-emiliano-sala-pilot-david-ibbotson-cardiff-city-nantes-psg-paris-saint-a8772396.html |title=Kylian Mbappe makes incredible donation to Emiliano Sala pilot David Ibbotson's search fund |newspaper=The Independent |date=10 February 2019 |access-date=10 February 2019 |archive-date=28 April 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190428120146/https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/kylian-mbappe-donation-search-emiliano-sala-pilot-david-ibbotson-cardiff-city-nantes-psg-paris-saint-a8772396.html |url-status=live}}</ref>

On 19 November 2021, Mbappé and Chinese diver [[Zhang Jiaqi (diver)|Zhang Jiaqi]] became godfather and godmother, respectively, to two baby [[panda]]s at [[Beauval Zoo]], as part of a campaign to raise awareness about the species.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/newsround/59336471 |title=Kylian Mbappe: French footballer becomes godfather to baby pandas |website=BBC Newsround |date=19 November 2021 |access-date=23 June 2022 |archive-date=23 June 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220623070405/https://www.bbc.co.uk/newsround/59336471 |url-status=live }}</ref>
